subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:16:59.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5b0f34834318d78f57333f55fa13216ab9bfda48', 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets neutron's
defaults when the generator is run on a system with everything installed
(such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name neutron instead, to
ensure that the defaults are only set when neutron's sample config and
documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets neutron's
defaults when the generator is run on a system with everything installed
(such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name neutron instead, to
ensure that the defaults are only set when neutron's sample config and
documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/87/291887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron = neutron.common.config:set_cors_middleware_defaults
deleted_lines: oslo.middleware.cors = neutron.common.config:set_cors_middleware_defaults

commit_message:
Pass RBD order to clone call

For cloning of a RBD the rbd_store_chunk_size information from
the cinder.conf should be used to calculate and pass the correct
order information to the clone() call of the rbd library.

Added new test to check for correctly from rbd_store_chunk_size
calculated order while cloning.

Closes-Bug: #1489134

Change-Id: Ic5714d3e0d6961bce6ff588006661618130dca07
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/87/289987/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: kwargs = {'features': client.features}

commit_message:
Clean cleanup context

Modules rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.manager and
rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.resources were deprecated in
previous release and we ready to remove them, since the produce a lot of
redundant warning messages.

__init__ module should be empty, so code from
rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.__init__ moves to
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.admin (AdminCleanup)
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.user (UserCleanup)
 -> rally.plugins.openstack.context.cleanup.base (base stuff)

Also tests.unit.plugins.openstack.context.test_cleanup is refactored too.

Change-Id: I25cf5750cb2de0d5652dc44db75818a5e10626eb

commit_message:
Add missing unit tests for L7 repo classes

This commit fleshes out the unit tests for the recently-added L7Rule and
L7Policy classes. While writing these unit tests, I realized with the
recently-improved l7policy sanitization / validation method that was
merged, the L7Policy update methods were doing work they didn't need to
be doing anymore. I have cleaned up the redundant code.

Closes-Bug: #1548905
Change-Id: I19a7fb6896bfec23b46594f694afb05393d95f93

commit_message:
Fix L7Policy update regression

It appears the improved L7Policy validation code recently merged broke
some types of L7Policy updates. This patch fixes this regression.

Further, the validations were reworked significantly since I had made an
incorrect assumption about which API parameters would be filled by the
l7policy API controller put method.

Change-Id: Ibd8723400d60e286e2704a8d52ac0baf582f38a3
Closes-Bug: #1555420

subject: Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 21:58:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/netns_cleanup.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/204336eaad742ce2ffb1e157967be0e3ca37d899', 'message': "Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/75/254975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The HA router in master l3 agent will have nopreempt=False. This

commit_message:
[WIP]Code change in l3 agent to consume master_l3_agent

The HA router in master l3 agent will have high priority, which
will make this HA router instance to be the master instance in
the vrrp election.

The HA router in master l3 agent will have nopreempt=False. This
can make sure this HA router instance to be the master instance,
when the keepalived rejoin the vrrp sync group.

Change-Id: Ia3d56f6e4853c71858c085e96cd6720bfebdf476
Partially-Implements: blueprint select-active-l3-agent

commit_message:
Enable SNMP support in keepalived

A lot of network monitoring uses SNMP. This patch will enable
an automated (or manual) query of keepalived state from a
remote box. This will enable integration with existing monitoring
systems.

Closes-Bug: #1460116
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iccf7e98192f2779c5032c3c18c53941e43aec8c1

commit_message:
Change call to cast when recipient doesn't return value

We have a few cases where we use call when the other side
doesn't have a return value, nor do we handle errors / exceptions
that might result from the call. In these cases there's no reason
to use call, and we can use cast, which is substantially faster.

Change-Id: I58579a6c253abd40fc49bf0cb26b805b34fbc288

commit_message:
WIP: delete ovs ports at once in netns-cleanup.

Change-Id: I7c6912f60a7b89874d57fa766775e807fe122882
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/24/261324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections cfg.BoolOpt('ovs_devices', default=False, help=_('When set to true, try to unplug/delete ' 'OVS ports only'))# store a list of device names for corresponding ovs bridge bridge_device_map = collections.defaultdict(list) def unplug_ovs_deferred(conf, dev_name): """Store dev_name into corresponding bridge's list.""" ovs = ovs_lib.BaseOVS() bridge_name = ovs.get_bridge_for_iface(dev_name) if bridge_name: bridge_device_map[bridge_name].append(dev_name) else: LOG.debug('Unable to find bridge for device: %s', dev_name) def delete_ovs_ports(): """Deletes all devices for each of OVS bridge.""" ovs = ovs_lib.BaseOVS() for br_name in bridge_device_map: with ovs.ovsdb.transaction() as txn: for ovs_port in bridge_device_map[br_name]: txn.add(ovs.ovsdb.del_port(ovs_port, br_name)) def unplug_device(conf, device): if conf.ovs_devices: unplug_ovs_deferred(conf, device.name) return delete_ovs_ports()
deleted_lines: def unplug_device(conf, device):

commit_message:
Utilize transactional execution of ovs port deletion.

This can significantly increase performance of operation
if python-ovs is used. Useful in netns-cleanup script
dealing with mass deletion of ovs ports.

Closes-Bug: #1529100
Change-Id: Ia4700e86d986e41b56fee89a5dd0c57d4a3b4096

commit_message:
Use os-client-config for common arguments

Rather than having explicit defines here in neutronclient, just use
the ones that are in os-client-config.

Change-Id: I8748d9cb54fed8b7a7ff0e82da99ab1484921a81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/96/242096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: WIP: Fix to allow SR-IOV and OVS VMs connectivity on the same host

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-06 14:07:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e561cc435a038162c945dad6128abc87f76dc873', 'message': 'WIP: Fix to allow SR-IOV and OVS VMs connectivity on the same host

commit_message:
WIP: Fix to allow SR-IOV and OVS VMs connectivity on the same host

When using SR-IOV, unknown MAC address from VF goes to wire, not to PF.
This cause problem if SR-IOV VM need connectivity to OVS VM on the
same network and on the same host, because in this case the traffic
should be sent via the PF.

This patch update the ovs agent to add fdb entry for each OVS VM
MAC on the required physical networks.
The fdb entry tells the eswitch to send the trafic via PF and not
on the wire. Config option is added to ovs agent
to tell for what physical networks this is required.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1492228

Change-Id: Ia62f6742de661ddf6e9657e01ea5661cfa76d7f4

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.tests.api import base from neutron.tests.tempest import config from neutron.tests.tempest import test from tempest_lib.common.utils import data_utils CONF = config.CONF class VLANTransparancyTest(base.BaseNetworkTest): """ Tests the Neutron API VLAN Transparency extension for ML2 Create VLAN transparent network List networks with VLAN Transparancy attribute Show VLAN transparent network Delete VLAN transparent network v2.0 of the Neutron API is assumed. """ @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(VLANTransparancyTest, cls).skip_checks() if not test.is_extension_enabled('vlan-transparent', 'network'): msg = 'VLAN transparency extension not enabled' raise cls.skipException(msg) @classmethod def test_create_list_show_delete_vlan_transparent_network(self): # Create a VLAN transparent network name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') network = self.create_network(network_name=name, vlan_transparent=True) self.addCleanup(self._delete_network, network) self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', network['status']) # Verify created network is vlan transparent self.assertEqual('true', network['vlan_transparent']) # Show network details body = self.client.show_network(network['id']) netbody = body['network'] for key in ['id', 'name']: self.assertEqual(netbody[key], network[key])

commit_message:
Properly handle case when chain name contains colon

While applying firewall rules, some pre-existing chains may suddenly
disappear and changes will not be commited.  This is caused by a typo in
duplicate filtering code.

Use str.partition() instead of str.split() when extracting chain name and
stripping counters from iptables script.

Unit test made in such way, that it runs full IptablesManager stack and
checks that all pre-existing chains are preserved.  This is done because
a) duplicate filtering code is hidden inside _modify_rules method and
b) real problem is that pre-existing chains were not preserved, and this
is what needs to be tested.

Closes-Bug: #1510124

Change-Id: I70e2a6d8e2ce2d6489c26adccb527f2405383547

Add log_config_append and logging_sample.conf.

This change adds logging_sample.conf and description
of log_config_append.
It would be useful for users who want to configure
about logging in detail.

commit_message:
Display binding errors at ERROR level

It's an informative message and will help operators determine that an
agent is misconfigured without having to increase the logging level to
DEBUG in order to catch it.

Change-Id: I4b2891f7b8b87cabc2c184d8b6ad505fcf8f767d
Closes-Bug: #1523616

commit_message:
Kill l3_hascheduler_db mixin

The goal is to simplify the L3 service plugin class hierarchy
a little bit. This patch removes the l3_hascheduler_db mixin,
and make L3_DVRsch_db_mixin inherit from AZL3AgentSchedulerDbMixin
instead.

I had issues with making list_l3_agents_hosting_router a module
level function because of cyclic imports, so I retained it in
the plugin, as part of the l3_hamode_db mixin.
get_agents_dict_for_router was used only in that function so I
made it a private function instead.

The other two functions in l3_hascheduler_db are now module
level functions instead of class methods, and receive the plugin
as a parameter.

Change-Id: I54649c6368ee62e71eb14a24b9c4666f293c9543

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"Returns an neutron client"
"Updates a address scope"

Should be:
"Return a neutron client"
"Updates an address scope"

Totally 2 occurrences in python-neutronclient base code.

Change-Id: Ie6177f175491b27a90cf77689d01aec2419b09fd

commit_message:
Filter dvr mode l3-agent when neutron server schedule ha router to additional agent

when dvr mode l3-agent run sync_router, neutron server will bind ha router
to this agent if ha router hasn't reach max_l3_agents_per_router setting in
neutron.conf. This will cause ha router run in computer nodes.

Change-Id: I769b79bc7e53219cca1a416313cf4d50c1fb1b13
Closes-Bug: #1526175

commit_message:
Allow to use system rootwrap

Tests depend on neutron-rootwrap installed in virtual environment.

neutron-rootwrap is provided by installing neutron with pip into
virtual environment. If neutron installed by any other means (OS
packages like rpm, deb) then it will fail to find neutron-rootwrap
executable and tests will fail.

The way to avoid such fail would be allow users to export variables
for thier own rootwrap deployed in the system. If user isn't
providing those variables, then the default values will be used.

This way, anyone who wants to run tests against deployed system
can do so, without depending on neutron installation in virtual
environment.

Change-Id: I9fbd24cc850fe9f0d56d246f5a5d18a8ecf4415c

commit_message:
[WIP] One alembic env for all neutron projects [WIP]

Initially when services and sub-projects started getting split out of
neutron, each project was given its own alembic environment. This
prevents projects alembic migrations from being able to depend on each
other.

This change switches to supporting just one neutron alembic
environment. We need to update existing branch labels include the
project name.

Closes-Bug: #1497830

Change-Id: I9ed61fd8788edfb4b87c450a4eecfcc79b6df7b3

commit_message:
Remove floating IP address from DVR router device

For DVR router, current code will try to adding floating IP address
onto router_2_fip device in DVR local router namespace. DVR local
router inherits this processing way from centralized router, but
with incorrect SNAT iptable rules for floating IP, it will cause
issue [1] for DVR router.

The solution is fixing previous SNAT iptable rules and removing
floating IP addresses from router_2_fip device in DVR local router
namespace.

[1] a VM ping another VM on the same host with the later one's
floating IP address, but get replied by the later one's fixed
IP address. https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1462154

Co-Authored-By: stephen-ma <stephen.ma@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1462154

Change-Id: I4c5cb0fc40048f88f1a741269e84550adacc8eac

commit_message:
l3_dvr: factor out agent notification

This patch factor out agent notification logic
fro L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin for code resuablility

Change-Id: I0018d17371af05c1422cde76ffc182258586d179
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/13/268813/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin(l3_db.L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin, l3_attrs_db.ExtraAttributesMixin): L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, self)._create_router_db( L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, self)._update_router_db( super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, return super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, self)._update_fip_assoc( return super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, def _check_dvr_router_remove_required( self._check_dvr_router_remove_required( def delete_csnat_router_interface_ports(self, context, router, subnet_id=None): # Each csnat router interface port is associated # with a subnet, so we need to pass the subnet id to # delete the right ports. # TODO(markmcclain): This is suboptimal but was left to reduce # changeset size since it is late in cycle ports = [ rp.port.id for rp in router.attached_ports.filter_by( port_type=l3_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) if rp.port ] c_snat_ports = self._core_plugin.get_ports( context, filters={'id': ports} ) for p in c_snat_ports: if subnet_id is None: self._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False) else: if p['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: LOG.debug("Subnet matches: %s", subnet_id) self._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False) class L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin(L3_NAT_with_dvr_dbonly_mixin, l3_db.L3_NAT_db_mixin): """Mixin class to enable DVR support.""" def _delete_current_gw_port(self, context, router_id, router, new_network): """ Overriden here to handle deletion of dvr internal ports. If there is a valid router update with gateway port to be deleted, then go ahead and delete the csnat ports and the floatingip agent gateway port associated with the dvr router. """ gw_ext_net_id = ( router.gw_port['network_id'] if router.gw_port else None) l3_db.L3_NAT_db_mixin._delete_current_gw_port( self, context, router_id, router, new_network) if (is_distributed_router(router) and gw_ext_net_id != new_network and gw_ext_net_id is not None): self.delete_csnat_router_interface_ports( context.elevated(), router) # NOTE(Swami): Delete the Floatingip agent gateway port # on all hosts when it is the last gateway port in the # given external network. filters = {'network_id': [gw_ext_net_id], 'device_owner': [l3_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW]} ext_net_gw_ports = self._core_plugin.get_ports( context.elevated(), filters) if not ext_net_gw_ports: self.delete_floatingip_agent_gateway_port( context.elevated(), None, gw_ext_net_id) # Send the information to all the L3 Agent hosts # to clean up the fip namespace as it is no longer required. self.l3_rpc_notifier.delete_fipnamespace_for_ext_net( context, gw_ext_net_id) def add_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): router_interface_info = super( L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self).add_router_interface( context, router_id, interface_info) self.notify_router_interface_action( context, router_interface_info, 'add') return router_interface_info def remove_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): router_interface_info = super( L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self).remove_router_interface( context, router_id, interface_info) self.notify_router_interface_action( context, router_interface_info, 'remove') return router_interface_info
deleted_lines: class L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin(l3_db.L3_NAT_db_mixin, l3_attrs_db.ExtraAttributesMixin): L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self)._create_router_db( L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self)._update_router_db( super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, # Send the information to all the L3 Agent hosts # to clean up the fip namespace as it is no longer required. self.l3_rpc_notifier.delete_fipnamespace_for_ext_net( context, gw_ext_net_id) super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, return super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self)._update_fip_assoc( self.notify_router_interface_action( context, router_interface_info, 'add') return super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, def _check_dvr_router_remove_required_and_notify_agent( self.notify_router_interface_action( context, router_interface_info, 'remove') self._check_dvr_router_remove_required_and_notify_agent( def delete_csnat_router_interface_ports(self, context, router, subnet_id=None): # Each csnat router interface port is associated # with a subnet, so we need to pass the subnet id to # delete the right ports. # TODO(markmcclain): This is suboptimal but was left to reduce # changeset size since it is late in cycle ports = [ rp.port.id for rp in router.attached_ports.filter_by( port_type=l3_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) if rp.port ] c_snat_ports = self._core_plugin.get_ports( context, filters={'id': ports} ) for p in c_snat_ports: if subnet_id is None: self._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False) else: if p['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: LOG.debug("Subnet matches: %s", subnet_id) self._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False)

commit_message:
Modified the configure_dhcp_for_network method

enable_dhcp_helper is prone to unhandled exceptions because of
configure_dhcp_for_network method.

This patch changes the configure_dhcp_for_network method to make it safer.
With this change, safe_configure_dhcp_for_network is redundant,
so removed it as it makes sense to have just one method instead of two.

Closes-Bug: #1495628
Change-Id: Ia9b1d19dd5b7c531fcfc669a341ff0eef2521c11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/26/223226/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.safe_configure_dhcp_for_network(network)
deleted_lines: self.configure_dhcp_for_network(network)

subject: Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-02 06:32:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ae15a0ff4749cf47c8b5a8611d53b8621aa1c8f4', 'message': 'Address timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

- When we encounter some exception servicing a network, we schedule a resync
  for that network. However, when we are resyncing, we try to get the
  information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC) present
  at the point of time. When there are quite a few networks in the cloud,this RPC
  times outs(with the default rpc_timeout of 60secs), and this results in an
  indefinite number of sync_states down the line. There is no guranteed time after
  which the DHCP agent gets stable again.

- Both get_active_networks and get_active_networks_info RPC handlers, call a helper
  method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries to schedule networks
  before returning the requested network information. It is a time taking process
  and more over this is not required when we are intersted in syncing for specific
  networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

Change-Id: If6df55df2a362813d63405beba62518f38841bff
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-02 06:34:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/62d2d938a234c86c59a12374a54819a82440c744', 'message': 'Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

- When an exception occurs while servicing a network, we schedule a
  resync for that network. However, when we are resyncing, we try to get
  the information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC)
  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in

  to schedule all the applicable networks before returning the requested
  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not
  required when we are intersted in syncing specific networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

  re-sync for that network. However, when we are re-syncing, we try to get
  the information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC)
  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in
  the cloud, this RPC times outs(with the default rpc_timeout of 60secs),
  and its resulting in an indefinite number of sync_state calls down the
  line. There is no guaranteed time after which the DHCP agent can get stable
  again.

- Both get_active_networks and get_active_networks_info RPC handlers
  call a helper method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries
  to schedule all the applicable networks before returning the requested
  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not
  required when we are interested in syncing specific networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

Closes-Bug: #1490308
Change-Id: If6df55df2a362813d63405beba62518f38841bff

commit_message:
Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

- When an exception occurs while servicing a network, we schedule a
  resync for that network. However, when we are resyncing, we try to get
  the information of all the active networks(get_active_networks_info RPC)
  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in
  the cloud, this RPC times outs(with the default rpc_timeout of 60secs),
  and its resulting in an indefinite number of sync_state calls down the
  line. There is no guranteed time after which the DHCP agent can get stable
  again.

- Both get_active_networks and get_active_networks_info RPC handlers
  call a helper method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries
  to schedule all the applicable networks before returning the requested
  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not
  required when we are intersted in syncing specific networks.

This patch attempts to fix the above gaps by fetching the network information
selectively instead of getting all the details all the while.

Closes-Bug: #1490308
Change-Id: If6df55df2a362813d63405beba62518f38841bff

commit_message:
Screen service q-lbaasv2 is not needed w/ octavia

The q-lbaasv2 screen service deployed by DevStack is not needed
when the Octavia driver is used. In README.md, the example used with
q-lbaasv2 should be removed to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I7e72ad619263c06fb62faef1c2f68bce6e13a71b
Closes-Bug:#1516064

subject: Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 21:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/netns_cleanup.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5c10da396d2637f982e04e2fae0c7efd78af9eaf', 'message': "Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the

(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)

commit_message:
Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
(cherry picked from commit cfc9578148985f117c230be263d9faab4c1bb57e)

Tests that use the helpers mentioned above should use an already

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-24 18:55:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bea4a1f723181e86349cb4ff70d10a34906175f5', 'message': "Refactor: Tests and helpers should use existing admin_context when possible

Refactoring Done by the following logic:
1. common helpers should have the option to accept context. If context
was not provided, retain existing behavior and invoke get_admin_context.
2. tests helpers (under the same class, or inherited class) should have
the option to get context from the test. otherwise, use the common helper with
self.adminContext.
3. tests should, when possible, provide context to any helper used.

commit_message:
Refactor: Tests and helpers should use existing admin_context when possible

Currently, helpers under neutron.tests.common.helpers won't accept an
existing admin context to use. Instead, they needlessly invoke
context.get_admin_context.

Tests that use the helpers mentioned above should use an already
existing admin_context. By doing so, we:
1. Guarantee all actions are being made under the same context
2. Significantly reduce the number of context.get_admin_context

Refactoring Done by the following logic:
1. common helpers should have the option to accept context. If context
was not provided, retain existing behavior and invoke get_admin_context.
2. tests helpers (under the same class, or inherited class) should have
the option to get context from the test. otherwise, use the common helper with
self.adminContext.
3. tests should, when possible, provide context to any helper used.

Change-Id: Ia09c2d404bf4761f69af720c30f5def1d78bf705

fw_group_req.get_response(self.ext_api) return fw_group_res @contextlib.contextmanager def firewall_group(self, fmt=None, name='', description='', ports=None, ingress_firewall_policy_id=None, egress_firewall_policy_id=None, do_delete=True, **kwargs): fmt = fmt or self.fmt res = self._create_firewall_group(fmt, name, description, ports, ingress_firewall_policy_id, egress_firewall_policy_id, do_delete=True, **kwargs) if res.status_int >= 400: raise webob.ex.HTTPClientError(code=res.status_int) fw_group = self.deserialize(fmt, res) yield fw_group if do_delete: kwargs.get('project_id', self._tenant_id) fw_policy = {'firewall_policy': {'name': name, 'description': description, 'project_id': project_id, 'public': public, 'firewall_rules': firewall_rules, 'audited': audited}} fw_policy_req = self.new_create_request('firewall_policies', fw_policy, fmt) fw_policy_res = fw_policy_req.get_response(self.ext_api) return fw_policy_res @contextlib.contextmanager def firewall_policy(self, fmt=None, name='', description='', public=False, firewall_rules=None, audited=False, do_delete=True, **kwargs): fmt = fmt or self.fmt res = self._create_firewall_policy(fmt, name, description, public, firewall_rules, audited, **kwargs) if res.status_int >= 400: raise webob.exc.HTTPClientError(code=res.status_int) firewall_policy = self.deserialize(fmt, res) yield firewall_policy if do_delete: self._delete('firewall_policies', firewall_policy['firewall_policy']['id']) def _create_firewall_rule(self, fmt, name, description, public, src_ip_address, dest_ip_address, src_address_group_id, dest_address_group_id, src_firewall_group_id, dest_firewall_group_id, ip_version, protocol, src_port, dest_port, service_group_id, action, enabled, **kwargs): project_id = kwargs.get('project_id', self._tenant_id) fw_rule = {'firewall_rule': {'name': name, 'description': description, 'project_id': project_id, 'public': public, 'destination_ip_address': dest_ip_address, 'source_ip_address': src_ip_address, 'source_address_group_id': src_address_group_id, 'destination_address_group_id': dest_address_group_id, 'source_firewall_group_id': src_firewall_group_id, 'destination_firewall_group_id': dest_firewall_group_id, 'ip_version': ip_version, 'protocol': protocol, 'source_port': src_port, 'destination_port': dest_port, 'service_group_id': service_group_id, 'action': action, 'enabled': enabled}} fw_rule_req = self.new_create_request('firewall_rules', fw_rule, fmt) fw_rule_res = fw_rule_req.get_response(self.ext_api) return fw_rule_res @contextlib.contextmanager def firewall_rule(self, fmt=None, name='', description='', source_ip_address=None, destination_ip_address=None, source_address_group_id=None, destination_address_group_id=None, source_firewall_group_id=None, destination_firewall_group_id=None, ip_version=IPV4, protocol=None, source_port=None, destination_port=None, service_group_id=None, public=False, action=DENY, enabled=True, do_delete=True, **kwargs): fmt = fmt or self.fmt res = self._create_firewall_rule(fmt, name, description, public, source_ip_address, destination_ip_address, source_address_group_id, destination_address_group_id, source_firewall_group_id, destination_firewall_group_id, ip_version, protocol, source_port, destination_port, service_group_id, action, enabled, **kwargs) if res.status_int >= 400: raise webob.exc.HTTPClientError(code=res.status_int) firewall_rule = self.deserialize(fmt, res) yield firewall_rule if do_delete: self._delete('firewall_rules', firewall_rule['firewall_rule']['id']) class TestFirewallDBPlugin(FirewallPluginDbTestCase): def test_create_address_group(self): with self.address_group(name=NAME, description=DESCRIPTION, cidrs=[]) as address_group: self.assertEqual(NAME, address_group['address_group']['name'])

commit_message:
Add check for assert(Not)In into hacking

We should use assert(Not)In(value, list) instead of
self.assertTrue(value in list) and self.assertFalse(value in list).
This patch adds check to detect these asserts.

Change-Id: Icd05d02a43d3703daa098545b704127b22179f2f
Related-Bug: #1218713

commit_message:
[WIP] Add IPv6 functional test-cases for dhcp-agent (OVS)

Added IPv6-version (DHCPv6 stateful) of existing functional tests
of dhcp-agent and refactored some functions related with this.
Work on DHCPv6 stateless tests in progress.

Partial-Bug: #1469065
Change-Id: I3a0b4e482dbd852b50778a13b11b691d488a9a4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/206033/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _remove_ip_for_interface(self, vif_name, namespace): ip_device = ip_lib.IPDevice(vif_name, namespace) ip_list = ip_device.addr.list(ip_version=4) for ip_address in ip_list: ip_device.addr.delete(ip_address.get('cidr')) def assert_bad_allocation_for_removed_port(self, network, port): vif_name, dhclient_cmd = self._get_allocation_params(network, port) self._remove_ip_for_interface(vif_name, network.namespace) self._run_dhclient(dhclient_cmd, network) eventlet.sleep(10) ip_list = self._ip_list_for_vif(vif_name, network.namespace) self.assertEqual([], ip_list) def test_bad_address_allocation_for_removed_port(self): network, port = self._get_network_port_for_allocation_test() network.ports.append(port) process_monitor = external_process.ProcessMonitor( config=cfg.CONF, resource_type='dhcp') dhcp_driver = self.agent.dhcp_driver_cls( cfg.CONF, network, process_monitor) dhcp_driver.reload_allocations() self._plug_port_for_dhcp_request(network, port) self.assert_good_allocation_for_port(network, port) network.ports.remove(port) dhcp_driver.reload_allocations() self.assert_bad_allocation_for_removed_port(network, port)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add the use of ebtables command

The linuxbridge-dvr feature uses ebtables to manage DVR packet.
This patch restored from [1] in order to add the use of ebtables
for the packet filter.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157634/

subject: Do not scope _get_by_id calls to context tenant ID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 09:16:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/030d4a699b965137fef0fcf082c5e1aea75f46ca', 'message': "Do not scope _get_by_id calls to context tenant ID

In our _get_by_id call we are currently scoping the database
queries to the tenant ID of the context. This makes it impossible
for other tenants to delete each others objects unless they are
an admin, even if policy.json allows it.

This patch adjusts the function to always use an elevated context
so it's queries will use the ID. The policy engine will still prevent
tenants from viewing/modifying each other's objects.

This patch also adjusts the delete_port policy to add an allow for
each field with policy enforced so it actually lets the request goes
through. Specifying this seems excessive so the enforcement of policy
on fields for a delete request should be revisited.

Finally, it enables the API test that was skipped because of this broken
behavior.

Change-Id: I920815a5c61df1d85664e14e1b9544795a922884
Closes-Bug: #1498790

commit_message:
Do not scope _get_by_id calls to context tenant ID

In our _get_by_id call we are currently scoping the database
queries to the tenant ID of the context. This makes it impossible
for other tenants to delete each others objects unless they are
an admin, even if policy.json allows it.

This patch adjusts the function to always use an elevated context
so it's queries will use the ID. The policy engine will still prevent
tenants from viewing/modifying each other's objects.

This patch also adjusts the delete_port policy to add an allow for
each field with policy enforced so it actually lets the request goes
through. Specifying this seems excessive so the enforcement of policy
on fields for a delete request should be revisited.

Finally, it enables the API test that was skipped because of this broken
behavior.

Change-Id: I920815a5c61df1d85664e14e1b9544795a922884
Closes-Bug: #1498790

commit_message:
Add check for assertIsNone into hacking

We should use assertIsNone(observed) instead of
assertEqual(None, observed).
This patch adds check to detect assertEqual(None, observed).

Change-Id: I0cfea74c04b90b006434e7f37ac99435b8dfb5aa
Related-Bug: #1503055
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/233144/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_assertisnone(self): fail_code1 = """ test_exist = None self.assertEqual(None, test_exist) """ fail_code2 = """ test_exist = None self.assertEqual(test_exist, None) """ pass_code = """ test_exist = None self.assertIsNone(test_exist) """ self.assertEqual( 1, len(list(checks.check_assertisnone( fail_code1, "neutron/tests/test_assert.py")))) self.assertEqual( 1, len(list(checks.check_assertisnone( fail_code2, "neutron/tests/test_assert.py")))) self.assertEqual( 0, len(list(checks.check_assertisnone( pass_code, "neutron/tests/test_assert.py"))))

commit_message:
Add get_schema_helper_from_stream()

In order to support passive connection to IDL, we need to have the stream
object to be created by the agent, pass it to idlutils in order to get the
schema from teh OVSDB server, than leave it open for the agent to keep using it,
without closing the connection as it is done in then current get_schema_helper()
function.

Code snippet:

...
session = Session.open(self.connection)
helper = idlutils.get_schema_helper_from_stream_no_close(
        session.stream,'hardware_vtep')
helper.register_all()
self.idl = idl.Idl(self.connection, helper, session)
idlutils.wait_for_change(self.idl, self.timeout)
...

Change-Id: I011e359b5b4d2abbf9bd749df81b3bad3b800614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/89/262789/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_schema_helper_from_stream(strm, schema_name): rpc = jsonrpc.Connection(strm) req = jsonrpc.Message.create_request('get_schema', [schema_name]) err, resp = rpc.transact_block(req) if err: raise Exception("Could not retrieve schema from %s: %s" % ( strm.name, os.strerror(err))) elif resp.error: raise Exception(resp.error) return idl.SchemaHelper(None, resp.result)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary apply for iptables

The iptables rules will be applied within the defer_apply in
process_external. No need to explicitly apply in other place.

Change-Id: If0ee222c3632fc3895f369ac12147ae0cb8156f7

commit_message:
Add functional test for remove_router_from_l3_agent

This patch add a functional test for remove_router_from_l3_agent
for DVR scenario, since we don't have a functional test for that
yet.

Change-Id: Ia4285dbe4a581776d12d2f5288fc7133ff0b4381

added_lines: def test_remove_router_from_dvr_snat_agent(self): router = self._create_router() kwargs = {'arg_list': (external_net.EXTERNAL,), external_net.EXTERNAL: True} with self.subnet() as subnet1, \ self.network(**kwargs) as ext_net, \ self.subnet(network=ext_net, cidr='20.0.0.0/24'), \ self.port(subnet=subnet1, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE) as port: self.core_plugin.update_port( self.context, port['port']['id'], {'port': {portbindings.HOST_ID: self.l3_agent['host']}}) self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, router['id'], {'subnet_id': subnet1['subnet']['id']}) self.l3_plugin._update_router_gw_info( self.context, router['id'], {'network_id': ext_net['network']['id']}) self.l3_plugin.schedule_router(self.context, router['id']) # Internal testing use only at this point.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 13:16:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/d00182bfbf4819ccfe5ca0181ec45780ff8dcf29', 'message': 'Update neutron security-group-list help text with --tenant-id

neutron security-group-list command has support for --tenant-id but
it is not mentioned in the neutron security-group-list --help.

Updating the help text with --tenant-id is affecting the
functionality of neutron security-group-list, since as of now the
--tenant-id is being handled as an extra argument.

So when --tenant-id is added to the help text its being parsed
as a known argument, which does not have support to handle the
command since the search_opts does not update when the tenant id
is passed as a known argument.

The following files have been modified to update the help text
with --tenant-id and to update the search opts when the
--teannt-id is passed as a known argument.

neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py
neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py

commit_message:
Support for --tenant-id in neutron security-group-list command.

In "neutron security-group-list --help", --tenant-id is not listed
as a supported argument. But when the command
"neutron security-group-list --tenant-id <TENANT_ID> is issued, it
will list the security groups related to the given <TENANT_ID>
instead of throwing any error. As neutron security-group-list
currently supports --tenant-id as an extra value.

The changes included in the following files add --tenant-id to
"neutron security-group-list --help" and update the search_opts
to handle --tenant-id as a parsed argument rather than extra value.

neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py
neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #1488912

Change-Id: I23f4a751a18dfeba365feafe73360bb8531773fc

Use vxlan_group from ML2 VXLAN type driver and deprecate agent's
vxlan_group configuration option. Move DEFAULT_VXLAN_GROUP into type
driver and use it as default for both configuration options for
consistency. Update type driver vxlan_group help text to reflect this
new default removing reference to unimplemented default of disabling
VXLAN over multicast.

Memoize vxlan_group as an IPNetwork object to avoid parsing IP address
string in each get_vxlan_group() call.  Remove no vxlan_group handling
from linux bridge manager since vxlan_group has a default and validation
is now done at initialization rather than first get_vxlan_group() call.

Refactor linuxbridge manager tests for invalid vxlan_group behavior
since this validation was moved into initialization for memoization.

commit_message:
WIP lb: use vxlan_group from type driver

Use vxlan_group from ML2 VXLAN type driver and deprecate agent's
vxlan_group configuration option.

TODO: refactor CommonAgentLoop extracting RPC concerns so RPC interface
can be initialized before LinuxBridgeManager

Memoize vxlan_group as an IPNetwork object to avoid parsing IP address
string in each get_vxlan_group() call.

Remove no vxlan_group handling from linux bridge manager since
vxlan_group has a default and validation is now done at initialization
rather than first get_vxlan_group() call.

Refactor linuxbridge manager tests for invalid vxlan_group behavior
since this validation was moved into initialization for memoization.

Change-Id: I3e668cf8806b3b1e501abb277caec38d833c8944
Closes-Bug: #1523614

A range of group " "addresses may be specified by using CIDR notation. " "When configured, will enable sending all broadcast " "traffic to this multicast group."))
deleted_lines: cfg.StrOpt('vxlan_group', help=_("Multicast group for VXLAN. When configured, will " "enable sending all broadcast traffic to this multicast " "group. When left unconfigured, will disable multicast " "VXLAN mode.")),

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 19:54:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8a887a3cc3e05b4243575353758ed1283b954213', 'message': 'ml2: change vxlan_group default

Change ml2 vxlan type driver vxlan_group default to match LinuxBridge

commit_message:
ml2: change vxlan_group default

Change ml2 vxlan type driver vxlan_group default to match LinuxBridge
agent default in preparation for deprecating LinuxBridge agent option.
Remove reference for using an unset vxlan_group value to disable
multicast support to ensure constancy with existing LinuxBridge agent
option.

This ml2 vxlan type driver configuration option is used anywhere in tree
today.

Change-Id: Ie54ef2b48ef727d2b229f7c09a86b325e7a1f165

commit_message:
Remove the pullup_route function

The pullup_router function should be removed,
I search the whole of the neutron catalog code,
but no other functions refer to it, and the decorative
message reminds: "Will be removed in the N cycle.".
So we need to remove the abandoned code.

Cleaned pep8 warning.

Change-Id: I36cff091b3122f5909740e76f1e829a05b3cc6b5

commit_message:
Return immediately if no agent be selected

if num_agents == 0 or hostable_agents == [] the
function should be return []. no need to call
select or bind.it can save time and avoid abnormal
 data pass other functions to cause possible problem.

Change-Id: Iff4a462f11d2999ac54d122a4ee7176efc299969

commit_message:
add maxconn to global option group

add maxconn number by user configuration
set default number is 2000 ,as haporxy used 2000 as default session limit
change unit test script for verify changed

Closes-Bug: #1516861
Change-Id: I4a0e3c23f3b244ba60ac24d34fd77aa0e77fd3e0

commit_message:
Defines the spec for new neutron blueprint to create an LBaaSv2 plugin
driver for F5 Networks applicances.

Change-Id: I34454250c6a49d952bb50adc19802acf528b7899
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/94/273794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Neutron LBaaSv2 driver for F5 Networks appliances ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/f5-lbaasv2-driver Neutron LBaaS v2 driver for F5 Networks appliances. Problem Description =================== Enable F5 Networks appliances to be LBaaS v2 backends. Proposed Change =============== The driver will implement the LBaaS v2 driver interface, as a shim to an open-source pypi package. This driver will include TLS and L7 functionality included in LBaaS v2. This driver will not support APP_COOKIE persistence. Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- Driver communicates with infrastructure hardware via https. Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None IPv6 Impact ----------- Will support ipv6 at the same level as neutron lbaas. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Pypi package 'f5lbaasdriver' must be installed prior to using this driver. Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: https://launchpad.net/~j-longstaff Work Items ---------- * Driver shim * Unit tests for shim * 3rd-party CI Dependencies ============ * LBaaS v2 Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- Third-party CI will run existing LB tempest tests with F5 Networks appliances. Functional Tests ---------------- Third-party CI will run existing LB functional tests with F5 Networks appliances. API Tests --------- Third-party CI will run existing LB API tests with F5 Networks appliances. Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- None References ========== * LBaaS v2 - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138205/

commit_message:
WIP: Redirect shims for new neutron-lib routines

This patchset installs neutron-lib as part of gate hook, which will
work for jobs using the hook, obviously.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Michali <pc@michali.net>
Change-Id: I02b1b723028f36bc483a6160e33e3ab2e8194f31

commit_message:
Add unit tests for L7 data model additions

This patch adds unit tests for the data model manipulations which were
added in L7 and the subsequent model update flow fix and session
persistence update fix patches. While writing these unit tests, it
became apparent that we could simplify some of the logic in the L7
Policy data model update method-- so this has been done.

Closes-Bug: #1548944
Change-Id: I0df4e234e3383cf310d6169349844a344633ba1a

self.vip.to_data_model()._get_unique_key()) self.assertEqual(self._get_unique_key(self.listener), self.listener.to_data_model()._get_unique_key()) self.assertEqual(self._get_unique_key(self.stats), self.l7policy.to_data_model()._get_unique_key()) self.assertEqual(self._get_unique_key(self.l7rule), self.l7rule.to_data_model()._get_unique_key()) self.assertEqual(1, l7policy.position) class TestDataModelManipulations(base.OctaviaDBTestBase, ModelTestMixin): def setUp(self): super(TestDataModelManipulations, self).setUp() self.lb = self.create_load_balancer(self.session) self.amphora = self.create_amphora(self.session) self.associate_amphora(self.lb, self.amphora) # This pool will be the listener's default_pool and be referenced # by self.l7policy self.pool = self.create_pool(self.session, load_balancer_id=self.lb.id) self.hm = self.create_health_monitor(self.session, self.pool.id) self.member = self.create_member(self.session, self.pool.id, id=self.FAKE_UUID_1, ip_address='10.0.0.1') self.sp = self.create_session_persistence(self.session, self.pool.id) self.vip = self.create_vip(self.session, self.lb.id) self.listener = self.create_listener(self.session, default_pool_id=self.pool.id, load_balancer_id=self.lb.id) self.stats = self.create_listener_statistics(self.session, self.listener.id) self.sni = self.create_sni(self.session, listener_id=self.listener.id) self.l7policy = self.create_l7policy( self.session, listener_id=self.listener.id, action=constants.L7POLICY_ACTION_REDIRECT_TO_POOL, redirect_pool_id=self.pool.id) self.l7rule = self.create_l7rule(self.session, l7policy_id=self.l7policy.id) # This pool, l7policy and l7rule are connected to the listener, # but are not the default_pool self.pool2 = self.create_pool( self.session, load_balancer_id=self.lb.id, id=uuidutils.generate_uuid()) self.l7policy2 = self.create_l7policy( self.session, listener_id=self.listener.id, action=constants.L7POLICY_ACTION_REDIRECT_TO_POOL, redirect_pool_id=self.pool2.id, id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), position=2) self.l7rule2 = self.create_l7rule( self.session, l7policy_id=self.l7policy2.id, id=uuidutils.generate_uuid()) # This pool is not connected to the listener at all self.pool3 = self.create_pool( self.session, load_balancer_id=self.lb.id, id=uuidutils.generate_uuid()) def test_dm_simple_update(self): lb = self.lb.to_data_model() self.assertIsNone(lb.name) lb.update({'name': 'test_name_change'}) self.assertEqual(lb.name, 'test_name_change') def test_dm_session_persistence_delete(self): sp = self.sp.to_data_model() pool = sp.pool sp.delete() self.assertIsNone(pool.session_persistence) def test_dm_listener_statistics_delete(self): stats = self.stats.to_data_model() listener = stats.listener stats.delete() self.assertIsNone(listener.stats) def test_dm_health_monitor_delete(self): hm = self.hm.to_data_model() pool = hm.pool hm.delete() self.assertIsNone(pool.health_monitor) def test_dm_pool_simple_update(self): pool = self.pool.to_data_model() self.assertIsNone(pool.name) pool.update({'name': 'new_pool_name'}) self.assertEqual(pool.name, 'new_pool_name') def test_dm_pool_session_persistence_update(self): pool = self.pool.to_data_model() self.assertEqual(pool.session_persistence.cookie_name, 'cookie_name') sp_dict = {'cookie_name': 'new_name'} pool.update({'session_persistence': sp_dict}) self.assertEqual(pool.session_persistence.cookie_name, 'new_name') def test_dm_pool_session_persistence_delete(self): pool = self.pool.to_data_model() self.assertEqual(pool.session_persistence.cookie_name, 'cookie_name') sp_dict = {} pool.update({'session_persistence': sp_dict}) self.assertIsNone(pool.session_persistence) def test_dm_pool_session_persistence_create(self): pool = self.pool.to_data_model() pool.update({'session_persistence': {}}) self.assertIsNone(pool.session_persistence) sp_dict = {'type': constants.SESSION_PERSISTENCE_HTTP_COOKIE, 'cookie_name': 'cookie_name'} pool.update({'session_persistence': sp_dict}) self.assertEqual(pool.session_persistence.type, constants.SESSION_PERSISTENCE_HTTP_COOKIE) self.assertEqual(pool.session_persistence.pool_id, pool.id) def test_dm_pool_delete(self): pool = self.pool.to_data_model() listener = pool.listeners[0] lb = pool.load_balancer l7policy = pool.l7policies[0] self.assertIn(pool, listener.pools) self.assertIn(pool, lb.pools) self.assertEqual(pool.id, l7policy.redirect_pool_id) pool.delete() self.assertNotIn(pool, listener.pools) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool_id) self.assertNotIn(pool, lb.pools) self.assertEqual(l7policy.action, constants.L7POLICY_ACTION_REJECT) self.assertIsNone(l7policy.redirect_pool_id) self.assertIsNone(l7policy.redirect_pool) def test_dm_member_delete(self): member = self.member.to_data_model() pool = member.pool self.assertIn(member, pool.members) member.delete() self.assertNotIn(member, pool.members) def test_dm_listener_update_and_clear_default_pool(self): listener = self.listener.to_data_model() new_pool = listener._find_in_graph('Pool' + self.pool3.id) self.assertNotEqual(new_pool.id, listener.default_pool_id) self.assertNotIn(listener, new_pool.listeners) self.assertNotIn(new_pool, listener.pools) listener.update({'default_pool_id': new_pool.id}) self.assertEqual(new_pool.id, listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIn(listener, new_pool.listeners) self.assertIn(new_pool, listener.pools) listener.update({'default_pool_id': None}) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool) self.assertNotIn(listener, new_pool.listeners) self.assertNotIn(new_pool, listener.pools) def test_dm_listener_update_clear_default_pool_with_l7p_referral(self): listener = self.listener.to_data_model() pool = listener.default_pool self.assertEqual(pool.id, listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIn(listener, pool.listeners) self.assertIn(pool, listener.pools) listener.update({'default_pool_id': None}) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIsNone(listener.default_pool) self.assertIn(listener, pool.listeners) self.assertIn(pool, listener.pools) def test_dm_listener_delete(self): listener = self.listener.to_data_model() lb = listener.load_balancer pools = listener.pools self.assertIn(listener, lb.listeners) for pool in pools: self.assertIn(listener, pool.listeners) listener.delete() self.assertNotIn(listener, lb.listeners) for pool in pools: self.assertNotIn(listener, pool.listeners) def test_dm_amphora_delete(self): amphora = self.amphora.to_data_model() lb = amphora.load_balancer self.assertIn(amphora, lb.amphorae) amphora.delete() self.assertNotIn(amphora, lb.amphorae) def test_dm_l7rule_delete(self): l7r = self.l7rule2.to_data_model() l7p = l7r.l7policy listener = l7p.listener pool2 = l7p.redirect_pool self.assertIn(pool2, listener.pools) self.assertNotEqual(pool2.id, listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIn(l7r, l7p.l7rules) self.assertEqual(1, len(l7p.l7rules)) l7r.delete() self.assertNotIn(l7r, l7p.l7rules) self.assertNotIn(pool2, listener.pools) def test_dm_l7policy_delete_with_listener_default_pool_ref(self): l7p = self.l7policy.to_data_model() listener = l7p.listener pool = l7p.redirect_pool self.assertIn(pool, listener.pools) self.assertEqual(pool.id, listener.default_pool_id) self.assertIn(l7p, subject: libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 20:39:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/688f89a4adbfaf6f9e0391cb5c09a316cd614165', 'message': "libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading

The _live_migration_operation method is accessing the nullable
attributes 'serial_listen_addr' and 'target_connect_addr' on the
LibvirtLiveMigrateData object which might not be set on the object.

Since they aren't lazy-loadable, this results in a NotImplementedError
if the attribute aren't set. This is fixed by adding conditional checks
in _live_migration_operation for the nullable attributes. Note that
bdms is nullable=False in the LiveMigrateDataObject and should be set
when the migrate_data object comes to the virt driver, so the test case
is updated in this case to fix the bdms attribute access.

There was a test hitting this, but because the libvirt driver runs
_live_migration_operation in a thread, the error was just being
logged and the test would pass.

So to fix that, the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture is used in the test
class to make the _live_migration_operation synchronous for that
test.

However, that doesn't fully resolve the gap in the test because
of the @catch_notimplemented decorator used on the test case. That
is meant for virt drivers which don't implement the live_migration
method but it can also allow silent failures in object attribute
access from bubbling up as failures. So this change also removes
that decorator from the test case.

Note that the tests themselves are pretty hacky in this case anyway
since while they are meant to be generic per virt driver, the
object passed down is LibvirtLiveMigrateData, which won't be
correct for xenapi, for example.

Closes-Bug: #1551925

Change-Id: I2744e99617d4e4834bb8372fa62dbad7686b1301

commit_message:
libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading

The _live_migration_operation method is accessing the nullable
attributes 'serial_listen_addr' and 'target_connect_addr' on the
LibvirtLiveMigrateData object which might not be set on the object.

Since they aren't lazy-loadable, this results in a NotImplementedError
if the attribute aren't set. This is fixed by adding conditional checks
in _live_migration_operation for the nullable attributes. Note that
bdms is nullable=False in the LiveMigrateDataObject and should be set
when the migrate_data object comes to the virt driver, so the test case
is updated in this case to fix the bdms attribute access.

There was a test hitting this, but because the libvirt driver runs
_live_migration_operation in a thread, the error was just being
logged and the test would pass.

So to fix that, the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture is used in the test
class to make the _live_migration_operation synchronous for that
test.

However, that doesn't fully resolve the gap in the test because
of the @catch_notimplemented decorator used on the test case. That
is meant for virt drivers which don't implement the live_migration
method but it can also allow silent failures in object attribute
access from bubbling up as failures. So this change also removes
that decorator from the test case.

Note that the tests themselves are pretty hacky in this case anyway
since while they are meant to be generic per virt driver, the
object passed down is LibvirtLiveMigrateData, which won't be
correct for xenapi, for example.

Closes-Bug: #1551925

Change-Id: I2744e99617d4e4834bb8372fa62dbad7686b1301

added_lines: from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures migration=migration, bdms=[]) def test_live_migration(self): self.skipTest('Live migration is not implemented in the base ' 'virt driver.') # This is needed for the live migration tests which spawn off the # operation for monitoring. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.SpawnIsSynchronousFixture())
deleted_lines: @catch_notimplementederror migration=migration)

subject: Fix session_persistence deletion bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 11:25:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/5d68f11520bcd0b30864f420a6dba7c7c9bdffe3', 'message': 'Fix session_persistence deletion bug

It turns out that the Neutron-LBaaS and Octavia (pecan) APIs work in
subtly different ways: In Neutron-LBaaS if the client API request
doesn't specify any given parameter, the dictionary for the API request
that gets passed to the underlying code does not have any of values that
were not specified in the API request populated. However, the Octavia
pecan-based API will populate all non-specified fields with None values.

This doesn't necessarily cause a problem unless you depend on a
parameter populated with None to indicate that parameter should be
deleted. This works fine for Neutron-LBaaS, but Octavia cannot tell the
difference between a parameter that wasn't specified and one that was
explicitly set to None in an update request. We don't normally depend on
a None value to delete an entity, but session_persistence is a bit of an
odd-ball in that it's embedded within the pool API.

To work around this behavioral quirk, I have updated the API code which
manages session_persistence to assume a default value that means
"preserve what is there" if the API request does not explicitly set the
value to None.

There was also a bug in Neutron-LBaaS' handling of session_persistence
which was making troubleshooting this problem more difficult. This patch
is dependent on the Neutron-LBaaS bugfix.

Beyond this, this patch also cleans up calls to
repository.update_pool_and_sp to not require the sp_dict parameter
(which, it turns out, did not need to be split out of the pool data
structure prior to calling this method anyway).

Closes-Bug: #1547157 Depends-On:
I654b172927e1d96677a7da9e0846231b0ac48aa9

Change-Id: Idcf12e463fbaa3a61a211f13986d8472f52036d2

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-03 00:12:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/5acac7321e7d126f912d961af730515df0dc29b7', 'message': 'Fix session_persistence deletion bug

It turns out that the Neutron-LBaaS and Octavia (pecan) APIs work in
subtly different ways: In Neutron-LBaaS if the client API request
doesn't specify any given parameter, the dictionary for the API request
that gets passed to the underlying code does not have any of values that
were not specified in the API request populated. However, the Octavia
pecan-based API will populate all non-specified fields with None values.

This doesn't necessarily cause a problem unless you depend on a
parameter populated with None to indicate that parameter should be
deleted. This works fine for Neutron-LBaaS, but Octavia cannot tell the
difference between a parameter that wasn't specified and one that was
explicitly set to None in an update request. We don't normally depend on
a None value to delete an entity, but session_persistence is a bit of an
odd-ball in that it's embedded within the pool API.

To work around this behavioral quirk, I have updated the API code which
manages session_persistence to assume a default value that means
"preserve what is there" if the API request does not explicitly set the
value to None.

There was also a bug in Neutron-LBaaS' handling of session_persistence
which was making troubleshooting this problem more difficult. This patch
is dependent on the Neutron-LBaaS bugfix.

Beyond this, this patch also cleans up calls to
repository.update_pool_and_sp to not require the sp_dict parameter
(which, it turns out, did not need to be split out of the pool data
structure prior to calling this method anyway).

Closes-Bug: #1547157
Depends-On: I654b172927e1d96677a7da9e0846231b0ac48aa9
Change-Id: Idcf12e463fbaa3a61a211f13986d8472f52036d2

commit_message:
Fix session_persistence deletion bug

Our code for updating a pool in the repository was off: You could
potentially update other pool parameters (ie. not session_persistence)
and it would unexpectedly clear the session_persistence. This patch
corrects this problem and cleans up the code dealing with session
persistence so that it's more understandable what it's doing.

There was also a bug in Neutron-LBaaS' handling of session_persistence
which was making troubleshooting this problem more difficult. This patch
is a prerequisite for the Neutron-LBaaS bugfix.

Beyond this, this patch also cleans up calls to
repository.update_pool_and_sp to not require the sp_dict parameter
(which, it turns out, did not need to be split out of the pool data
structure prior to calling this method anyway).

Closes-Bug: #1547157
Change-Id: Idcf12e463fbaa3a61a211f13986d8472f52036d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/18/287118/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def _validate_create_pool(self, session, sp_dict, pool_dict): session, pool_dict, listener_id=self.listener_id, sp_dict=sp_dict) sp_dict = pool_dict.pop('session_persistence', None) return self._validate_create_pool(context.session, sp_dict, pool_dict)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:29:24.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/dde2c72d750fb640e52d385a4206f11c58ed53ec', 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this

commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/290847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.drvr.migrate_disk_and_power_off(context.get_admin_context(), instance, mock.sentinel, flavor_obj, None)

commit_message:
Set doc_values on field definitions

Using the doc_values field storage format can result in dramatically
reduced memory usage at the cost of some disk space. This patch enforces
what is the default in Elasticsearch 2.x. It does so by modifying the
mapping to add doc_values: True for appropriate field types. This can
be overridden globally in configuration, per plugin via a property or
for individual field types.

See
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/guide/current/doc-values.html

This is an alternative to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/287401/

Change-Id: I5e5fb880657fcab7223e0e5f7525aec07fbdf612
Closes-Bug: #1498995

commit_message:
Allow recovering from an invalid failback command

If the driver determines the backend is not ready to be failed back,
there needs to be a way to keep the host's replication_status in a
failed-over state rather than forcing it into 'error' or 'failing-over'
state where it cannot be recovered.

Drivers should raise UnabableToFailBack in order to keep the host
failed-over so they can try again when the issue is resolved.

This patch also saves the hosts state in the event of UnableToFailOver
or InvalidReplicationTarget is raised.

Change-Id: Ie70fb296815db3056afc51e0c5403653962a567d
Closes-Bug: #1555814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/49/291449/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class UnableToFailBack(Invalid): message = _("Failback cannot be completed at this time: %(reason)s")

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 21:08:51.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/6a72ea2838bee6f2318ea81bf5f8a8db49e1afa9', 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/13/291913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: murano = murano.common.config:set_middleware_defaults
deleted_lines: oslo.middleware = murano.common.config:set_middleware_defaults

commit_message:
ODL v2: Security Group support

This commits refactors the Opendaylight security group code to handle
race conditions and out of sync issues. It attempts to address these
using an atomic thread synchronization model that tracks the sync,
retry, success and failed states of Neutron objects sent to Opendaylight.

Change-Id: Ia1742bfd30aeef0ad9216e4b02d6a97751b276c3
Partial-Bug: #1493551

commit_message:
Make Nova scheduler filter work with Liberty

It turns out that the semantics of getting to the scheduler hints
changed between Liberty and Mitaka, so the straight backport of the
scheduler filter doesn't work.  This changes the filter so it
accesses the scheduler hints in a way that is compatible with Nova
in Liberty.

Change-Id: I92c2f24bfb0e2dce147acafb88f756b529b0b48b

commit_message:
[OraclePDBConnector] Initial commit of Oracle PDB Connector.

This application enables creation of Oracle Pluggable Databases
on top of Oracle Container Database.

All instructions for application deployment are provided in readme.rst.

Change-Id: Id7a9823dcc43f65fd90805e21758ec9298b39283

[OraclePDBConnector] Initial commit of Oracle PDB Connector.

This application enables creation of Oracle Pluggable Databases
on top of Oracle Container Database.
This patch corrects a typo in manifest.yaml, removes agent availability
check and removes multiple calls to createAgent().

Change-Id: I076eda8fd87f2245555e40b33c2c2643d8ed554d

commit_message:
Fix processing of libvirt disk.info in non-disk-image cases

In Idfc16f54049aaeab31ac1c1d8d79a129acc9fb87 a change was made
that caused non-disk-image backends to fall over because of an
undefined variable because they skipped processing of the disk.info
file. This adds a check for that case to make sure we don't run
that path in the non-disk-image backend case.

Closes-Bug: #1555287

Change-Id: I02f8a5f0e29816336e500a8fe8dcc9ece15968e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/290715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor TestFernetTokenProvider project-scoped tests

These tests were not specific to the Fernet provider and they should live in
the general TokenAPITests class so that the behavior is tested against all
token providers.

Subsequent patches will do the same for trust-scoped tokens.

Change-Id: If13028e613b69754718fb756f8621ec8cf655d7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/08/286908/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_project_scoped_token(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.user['password'], project_id=self.project_id) return self._make_auth_request(auth_data) def test_validate_project_scoped_token(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) def test_revoke_project_scoped_token(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) self._revoke_token(project_scoped_token) self._validate_token(project_scoped_token, expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND) def test_project_scoped_token_is_invalid_after_disabling_user(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Disable the user self._set_user_enabled(self.user, enabled=False) # Ensure validating a token for a disabled user fails self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token) def test_project_scoped_token_invalid_after_changing_user_password(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Update user's password self.user['password'] = 'Password1' self.identity_api.update_user(self.user['id'], self.user) # Ensure updating user's password revokes existing tokens self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token) def test_project_scoped_token_invalid_after_disabling_project(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Disable project self.project['enabled'] = False self.resource_api.update_project(self.project['id'], self.project) # Ensure validating a token for a disabled project fails self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token)
deleted_lines: def test_validate_project_scoped_token(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) def test_revoke_project_scoped_token(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) self._revoke_token(project_scoped_token) self._validate_token(project_scoped_token, expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND) def test_project_scoped_token_is_invalid_after_disabling_user(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Disable the user self._set_user_enabled(self.user, enabled=False) # Ensure validating a token for a disabled user fails self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token) def test_project_scoped_token_invalid_after_changing_user_password(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Update user's password self.user['password'] = 'Password1' self.identity_api.update_user(self.user['id'], self.user) # Ensure updating user's password revokes existing tokens self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token) def test_project_scoped_token_invalid_after_disabling_project(self): project_scoped_token = self._get_project_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(project_scoped_token) # Disable project self.project['enabled'] = False self.resource_api.update_project(self.project['id'], self.project) # Ensure validating a token for a disabled project fails self.assertRaises(exception.TokenNotFound, self.token_provider_api.validate_token, project_scoped_token)

commit_message:
Refactor TestFernetTokenProvider domain-scoped tests

These tests were not specific to the Fernet provider and they should live in
the general TokenAPITests class so that the behavior is tested against all
token providers.

Subsequent patches will do the same for project-scoped tokens and trust-scoped
tokens.

Change-Id: I3d0bfa5bd9ca1a5d89e5125bed86fe1672f12b39

Grant user access to domain self.assignment_api.create_grant(self.role['id'], user_id=self.user['id'], domain_id=self.domain['id']) domain_scoped_token = self._get_domain_scoped_token() resp = self._validate_token(domain_scoped_token) resp_json = json.loads(resp.body) self.assertIsNotNone(resp_json['token']['catalog']) self.assertIsNotNone(resp_json['token']['roles']) self.assertIsNotNone(resp_json['token']['domain']) def test_domain_scoped_token_is_invalid_after_disabling_user(self): # Grant user access to domain self.assignment_api.create_grant(self.role['id'], user_id=self.user['id'], domain_id=self.domain['id']) domain_scoped_token = self._get_domain_scoped_token() # Make sure the token is valid self._validate_token(domain_scoped_token) #
