commit_message:
Refactor TestFernetTokenProvider unscoped token tests

These tests were not specific to the Fernet provider and they should live in
the general TokenAPITests class so that the behavior is tested against all
token providers.

Subsequent patches will do the same for domain-scoped and project-scoped
tokens.

Change-Id: I517e5e4f4cd185b8791960fd21b7969f1991fd2f

Remove doc references to the keystone CLI

There were a couple of references to the keystone CLI which doesn't
exist anymore. This was causing warnings when building the docs.

commit_message:
Disallow scheduling multiple replicas on a given pool

Currently, while scheduling a new replica, the ShareReplicationFilter
passes any host that shares the replication_domain of the active
replica's host. On successive runs on the CI, it was observed
that the same host was chosen multiple times. In a real
deployment, there is no practicality in allowing replication
within the same pool.

Pass more information to assist the filter in disqualifying hosts that
already host replicas for the share.

Also treat NoValidHost exception differently from other scheduler
exceptions to be consistent with other scheduling failures.

Change-Id: Iedc7b752c7fc477d6257d100e2277378d59f1fde
Closes-Bug: #1554282

subject: Use 'is None' rather than 'is_null()' in matches
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 21:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/334b824fae6f1b99727b2415745649c5f84184af', 'message': "Use 'is None' rather than 'is_null()' in matches

Currently in the matches function for api versions the function
'is_null()' is called on both the min_version parameter and the
max_version parameter. However, these parameters are intended to
be strings, and there is no is_null function on strings so the
function results in an error. This patch changes them to 'is None',
since the is_null function is specific to the APIVersionRequest and
it's only checking if it's values are None as well.

Change-Id: I83ad6aa325650c50b1c0bae8b389370eff4238de
Closes-bug: #1555817
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'is None' rather than 'is_null()' in matches

Currently in the matches function for api versions the function
'is_null()' is called on both the min_version parameter and the
max_version parameter. However, these parameters are intended to
be strings, and there is no is_null function on strings so the
function results in an error. This patch changes them to 'is None',
since the is_null function is specific to the APIVersionRequest and
it's only checking if it's values are None as well.

Change-Id: I83ad6aa325650c50b1c0bae8b389370eff4238de
Closes-bug: #1555817

commit_message:
Rename v2 token schema used for validation

Move the v2 token validation schema to an appropriate
location. Also, make minor changes to Fernet assertion
methods under test_v2.

Change-Id: I5b1a255807ce26b13fcf14fda85708eb524de837

commit_message:
Sync paths in POT files with CI scripts

The infra scripts which handle translation support for horizon
was recently changed to remove horizon special handling.
As a result, file paths in POT files now contains module names
(openstack_dashboard or horizon).

This commit update pybabel related functions in run_tests.sh
so that even when we run ./run_tests.sh --makemessages in
local env POT files are not changed unexpectedly.

Change-Id: I32e83244e7fa3a4f6039573a97f1b0dca9fdd4c8

deleted_lines: DOMAIN=$1 KEYWORDS="-k gettext_noop -k gettext_lazy -k ngettext_lazy:1,2" ${command_wrapper} pybabel extract -F ../babel-${DOMAIN}.cfg -o locale/${DOMAIN}.pot $KEYWORDS . cd horizon babel_extract django babel_extract djangojs cd ../openstack_dashboard babel_extract django babel_extract djangojs cd ..

commit_message:
Migrate_repo init version helper

Helper function to determine init version for migrate repository. We
need single automated entry point to determine an initial versions of
repositories. Hardcoded and distributed initial version values could
contain wrong (for example old) value.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Perry <sean.perry@hpe.com>

Closes-Bug: #1397903
Change-Id: I89616a2cf7a752fbe97591d5694b14f8b86e4539
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/40/137640/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _initial_db_version = migration_helpers.get_init_version() self._initial_db_version) self._initial_db_version, 'DB is not at version %s' % self._initial_db_version) Starting with the initial version. Downgrade to the init version does not occur based on the requirement that the base version be init version + 1 before migration can occur. Downgrade below init version + 1 is no longer init version is the number preceding the release schema version from two releases prior. Example, Juno releases with the init version for x in range(self._initial_db_version + 1, if downgrade_ver != self._initial_db_version: self.upgrade(self._initial_db_version + 1) self.downgrade(self._initial_db_version + 1) self._initial_db_version) _initial_db_version = migration_helpers.get_init_version() self.assertEqual(self._initial_db_version, version)
deleted_lines: from keystone.common.sql import migrate_repo _initial_db_version = migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION) migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION, 'DB is not at version %s' % migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION) Starting with the initial version defined at keystone.common.migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION Downgrade to the DB_INIT_VERSION does not occur based on the requirement that the base version be DB_INIT_VERSION + 1 before migration can occur. Downgrade below DB_INIT_VERSION + 1 is no longer DB_INIT_VERSION is the number preceding the release schema version from two releases prior. Example, Juno releases with the DB_INIT_VERSION for x in range(migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION + 1, if downgrade_ver != migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION: self.upgrade(migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION + 1) self.downgrade(migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION + 1) migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION) _initial_db_version = migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION self.assertEqual(migrate_repo.DB_INIT_VERSION, version)

subject: Fix location update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 16:12:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/a654374781205b3200efccce0ed4c5d9578a5340', 'message': 'Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch fixes the issue
and a test case is added.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-16 20:57:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/dc3a59a8b1c4d3e1705348f95c5bf6e006859d04', 'message': 'Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch fixes the issue
and a test case is added.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-29 22:04:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/2303c2b21f503acad35ab83635bb52fb30b24292', 'message': "Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch removes the updating
for an image from non-empty to empty since it's not supported now.
And also removing the default value of metadata for location-update
cli command because now the only purpose of location-update is updating
the location's metadata, so it doesn't make sense to give it a default
value which may update existing metadata by mistake.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:38:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/15f67217293c8cae1cd1f6f04ff968c546d8e725', 'message': "Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch removes the updating
for an image from non-empty to empty since it's not supported now.
And also removing the default value of metadata for location-update
cli command because now the only purpose of location-update is updating
the location's metadata, so it doesn't make sense to give it a default
value which may update existing metadata by mistake.

commit_message:
Fix location update

After commit Ieb03aaba887492819f9c58aa67f7acfcea81720e, the command
location-update is totally broken now. This patch removes the updating
for an image from non-empty to empty since it's not supported now.
And also removing the default value of metadata for location-update
cli command because now the only purpose of location-update is updating
the location's metadata, so it doesn't make sense to give it a default
value which may update existing metadata by mistake.

Closes-Bug: #1537626

Change-Id: I9ce98e6c63996bbfdbc56761055e37a871f9d3e2

commit_message:
Install master's version of an RDO keystone

RDO isn't moving for approxximately 1 week new packages into
current-passed-ci.  This blocks Sam's keystone bootstrap patch.

To unblock this, we temporarily have provided copr built RPMs
based upon the srpm from RDO and keystone-master tarball.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic0fe30c56e8dd229f2a25157125272324621bad9

commit_message:
improve documentation about registering entry points for config generator

Change-Id: I166033ca3073325004bacaabcbee729e4cf4f809
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/04/291904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **the application's** ``list_opts()`` function... warning:: Never, under any circumstances, register an entry point using a name owned by another project. Doing so causes unexpected interplay between projects within the config generator and will result in failure to generate the configuration file or invalid values showing in the sample. In this case, the name of the entry point for the default override function *must* match the name of one of the entry points defining options for the application in order to be detected and used. Applications that have multple list_opts functions should use one that is present in the inputs for the config generator where the changed defaults need to appear. For example, if an application defines ``foo.api`` to list the API-related options, and needs to override the defaults in the ``oslo.middleware.cors`` library, the application should register ``foo.api`` under ``oslo.config.opts.defaults`` and point to a function within the application code space that changes the defaults for ``oslo.middleware.cors``.
deleted_lines: the application's ``list_opts()`` function.

commit_message:
Report number of changed jobs

Check how many jobs have been changed and report that number.
Do not abort if the diff or grep fails to find anything.

Change-Id: I7f655f65cbe4d5cd084af2bda645ba57697ba3be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/89/291789/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Number of changed jobs:" diff -r -N -u .test/old/out .test/new/out |grep '^--- .test' |wc -l

commit_message:
Configure nova to use custom scheduler filter

The dependency adds a new scheduler filter that is required for
predictable placement of nodes.  This simply configures Nova to
use the new filter.

Change-Id: Ie25d2aacf3b496fd5f02071adc5b2e09e37a8684
Depends-On: I92c2f24bfb0e2dce147acafb88f756b529b0b48b
(cherry picked from commit 75660dbe5aceeaf1770f72772ec5d4d170f4b643)

added_lines: nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_available_filters: 'tripleo_common.filters.list.tripleo_filters' nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_default_filters: ['RetryFilter', 'TripleOCapabilitiesFilter', 'ComputeCapabilitiesFilter', 'AvailabilityZoneFilter', 'RamFilter', 'DiskFilter', 'ComputeFilter', 'ImagePropertiesFilter', 'ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter', 'ServerGroupAffinityFilter']

commit_message:
module to set quotas per volume type

This will set the quotas per volume type passed in

Change-Id: I6af7347cbf8d907a7cc004a594aafdb2745c280f

added_lines: #Author: Craig DeLatte <craig.delatte@twcable.com> require 'spec_helper' describe 'cinder::quota_set' do let(:title) {'hippo'} let :params do { :os_password => 'asdf', :os_tenant_name => 'admin', :os_username => 'admin', :os_auth_url => 'http://127.127.127.1:5000/v2.0/', } end it 'should have its execs' do is_expected.to contain_exec('cinder quota-update default --volumes $quota_volumes --snapshots $quota_snapshots --gigabytes $quota_gigabytes --volume-typehippo').with( :command => 'cinder quota-update default --volumes $quota_volumes --snapshots $quota_snapshots --gigabytes $quota_gigabytes --volume-type hippo', :environment => [ 'OS_TENANT_NAME=admin', 'OS_USERNAME=admin', 'OS_PASSWORD=asdf', 'OS_AUTH_URL=http://127.127.127.1:5000/v2.0/'], :require => 'Package[python-cinderclient]') end end

commit_message:
Documentation for reflection capabilities in MuranoPL

Change-Id: I6be2986e7731e63d4fb8461f76ac47acc17e6a3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/70/291070/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _reflection: Reflection capabilities in MuranoPL. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Reflection provides objects that describes MuranoPL classes and packages. The first important function is ``typeinfo`` . Usage: .. code-block:: yaml $typeInfo: typeinfo($someObject) Now ``$typeInfo`` variable contains instance of type of ``$someObject`` (``MuranoClass`` instance). MuranoPL provide following abilities to reflection: .. _types_reflection: Types ----- .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Property - Description * - ``name`` - name of MuranoPL class * - ``version`` - version (`SemVer`_) of MuranoPL class. * - ``ancestors`` - list of class ancestors * - ``properties`` - list of class properties. See :ref:`properties_reflection` * - ``package`` - package information. See :ref:`package_reflection` * - ``methods`` - list of methods. See :ref:`methods_reflection` * - ``type`` - reference to type, which can be used as argument in engine functions *Example* .. code-block:: yaml - $typeInfo: typeinfo($) ... # log name, version and package name of this class - $log.info("This is "{class_name}/{version} from {package}", class_name => $typeInfo.name, version => str($typeInfo.version, package => $typeInfo.package.name)) - $log.info("Ancestors:") - For: ancestor In: $typeInfo.ancestors Do: #log all ancestors names - $log.info("{ancestor_name}", ancestor_name => $ancestor.name) # log full class version - $log.info("{version}", version => str($typeInfo.version)) # create object with same class - $newObject = new($typeInfo.type) .. _properties_reflection: Properties ---------- Property introspection ++++++++++++++++++++++ .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Property - Description * - ``name`` - name of property * - ``hasDefault`` - boolean value. `True`, if property has default value, `False` otherwise * - ``usage`` - `Usage` property's field. See :ref:`action_usage` for details * - ``declaringType`` - type - owner of declared property Property access +++++++++++++++ .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Methods - Description * - ``$property.setValue($target, $value)`` - set value of ``$property`` for object ``$target`` to ``$value`` * - ``$property.getValue($target)`` - get value of ``$property`` for object ``$target`` *Example* .. code-block:: yaml - $typeInfo: typeinfo($) ... # select first property - $selectedPropety: $typeInfo.properties.first() # log property name - $log.info("Hi, my name is {p_name}, p_name => $selectedProperty.name) # set new property value - $selectedProperty.setValue($, "new_value") # log new property value using reflection - $log.info("My new value is {value}", value => $selectedProperty.getValue($)) # also, if property static, $target can be null - $log.info("Static property value is {value}, value => $staticProperty.getValue(null)) .. _package_reflection: Packages -------- .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Property - Description * - ``types`` - list of types, declared in package * - ``name`` - package name * - ``version`` - package version *Example* .. code-block:: yaml - $typeInfo: typeinfo($) ... - $packageRef: $typeInfo.package - $log.info("This is package {p_name}/{p_version}", p_name => $packageRef.name, p_version => str($packageRef.version)) - $log.info("Types in package:") - For: type_ In: $packageRef.types Do: - $log.info("{typename}", typename => type_.name) .. _methods_reflection: Methods ------- Methods properties ++++++++++++++++++ .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Property - Description * - ``name`` - method's name * - ``declaringType`` - type - owner of declared method * - ``arguments`` - list of method's arguments. See :ref:`arguments_reflection` Method invoking +++++++++++++++ .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Methods - Description * - ``$method.invoke($target, $arg1, ... $argN, kwarg1 => value1, ..., kwargN => valueN)`` - call ``$target``'s method $method with ``$arg1``, ..., ``$argN`` positional arguments and ``kwarg1``, .... ``kwargN`` named arguments *Example* .. code-block:: yaml - $typeInfo: typeinfo($) ... # select single method by name - $selectedMethod: $typeInfo.methods.where($.name = sampleMethodName).single() # log method name - $log.info("Method name: {m_name}", m_name => $selectedMethod.name) # log method arguments names - For: $argName In: $selectedMethod.arguments.name Do: - $log.info("{name}", name => $argName) # call method with positional argument 'bar' and named `baz` == 'baz' - $selectedMethod.invoke($, 'bar', baz => baz) .. _arguments_reflection: Method arguments ---------------- .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 :widths: 20 80 :stub-columns: 0 :class: borderless * - Property - Description * - ``name`` - argument's name * - ``hasDefault`` - `True` if argument has default value, `False` otherwise * - ``declaringMethod`` - method - owner of argument .. code-block:: yaml - $firstArgument: $selectedMethod.arguments.first() # store argument's name - $argName = $firstArgument.name # store owner's name - $methodName = $firstArgument.declaringMethod.name - $log.info("Hi, my name is {a_name} ! My owner is {m_name}", a_name => $argName, m_name => $methodName) .. Links: .. _`SemVer`: http://semver.org

commit_message:
Workaround debug DuplicateOptError with generator

The oslo-config-generator error is caused by including
oslo.middleware.cors in the generator file.  A workaround for
bringing in same named options twice is to ensure Oslo Log incubator
options attributes match those of Oslo Log.

Change-Id: I11b9b29d186e4ea33e0559264c42c5008a2ccbcd
Related-Bug: #1555788

commit_message:
Fix PUT tag failure

This patch fix failure putting tag on network.
Timestamp causes the issue because it try to update 'updated_at'
of tag which doesn't have the attribute.

Change-Id: Iad088bbaf4b05a25153964ed30762b70fc8b3318
Closes-Bug: #1555686

commit_message:
DON'T MERGE Remove allow_overlapping_ips

I'm just pushing this up to see what breaks by taking this out (if
anything).  Also, to collect feedback on the idea of deprecating and
removing it.  If we do decide to remove this it should be properly
deprecated and removed a release later, not like this.  So, if I move
forward I'll do it properly.

Seems to me like we have overlapping IP capability everywhere.  What
prevents us from removing this?  This has been brought up at least
once on the mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-May/036336.html

Change-Id: I473540b750f35603914b8afeb8166f723faf709d
Related-Bug: #1438320

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:33:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/solum/commit/926b901a93713449f02de7e75b8f98f908461a90', 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/99/291899/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: oslo.middleware.cors = solum.common.config:set_cors_middleware_defaults

Include metric value in alarm notification message.

With commit 4e333d5fe4d069178045e1bb3935f9a4ee2be3bf notification
messages look like '...with the values: []', this fixes that.

Change-Id: I8e96b4aa5c77f74a9d3dd00a5647fbfde5fde9b2
Closes-Bug: #1554718

commit_message:
Move replication volume manager warnings to info

These two messages are printing at the warning level
when starting c-vol.

Since these don't seem to be something that demands
attention, they should be logged at a lower level.

Change-Id: I3db6ed3956348895b3534cdc9f3f72bb4c878aca

commit_message:
fix formatting of return-request-id-to-caller release note

The release note was not escaping the restructuredtext constructs
properly so the YAML parser was wrapping the lines together.

Change-Id: I8ae7e70c4e97d4a26de265f9fc48122be75224bb

subject: Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 20:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['manila/opts.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/1f8e55265bff6d66466bee60ba36006cb4311908', 'message': 'Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency

Since the introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
config generation for manila via oslo-condig-generator fails unless
pylxd is installed on the system. This is likely an unwanted dependency
as it is problematic for distributions that do not include LXD and which
will not therefore distribute a packaged version of pylxd.

manila/opts.py currently does an unconditional import of
manila/share/drivers/lxd.  This commit makes the import and accompanying
option processing conditional on the presence of the pylxd module on
the system generating the config.

[1] commit 4f74b224fad7bf9ca665d70a66c79c98cf8d5674

Change-Id: I6bbc922435b9650a6b1cc4a19b15a61b1f617784
Closes-bug: #1553208
'}]
commit_message:
Remove config generation pylxd hard dependency

Since the introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
config generation for manila via oslo-condig-generator fails unless
pylxd is installed on the system. This is likely an unwanted dependency
as it is problematic for distributions that do not include LXD and which
will not therefore distribute a packaged version of pylxd.

manila/opts.py currently does an unconditional import of
manila/share/drivers/lxd.  This commit makes the import and accompanying
option processing conditional on the presence of the pylxd module on
the system generating the config.

[1] commit 4f74b224fad7bf9ca665d70a66c79c98cf8d5674

Change-Id: I6bbc922435b9650a6b1cc4a19b15a61b1f617784
Closes-bug: #1553208

commit_message:
Add ability to set IPv6 routes in os-net-config templates

This change adds the ability to write IPv6 routes to the system
NIC configuration. In the ifcfg provider, IPv6 routes must be
written to network-scripts/route6-<interface> rather than
route-interface. This patch checks the next hop, and if it is an
IPv6 address (assumed because of the presence of ":"), then the
route will be written to route6-<interface>. This patch includes
tests to confirm proper operation.

Change-Id: I3563800c774a6082a896c7508f5a92e25418fe63

commit_message:
Use the retry decorator for methods adding/removing virt res

In some cases, the add_virt_resource method fails because of what
seems to be a Hyper-V race condtion.

This change adds a retry decorator for this method, as well as the
one removing virt resources.

Change-Id: Ib526181b95ed84bdbc755e549a960ab2ca8d285c

subject: register the config generator default hook with the right name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:32:40.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/fd1508faad56c8f9b6e2c98121cc9ebe7c5c34ea', 'message': "register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
register the config generator default hook with the right name

No config generator hooks should ever be registered with a name that
belongs to another project. In this case, using oslo.middleware.cors
means that *every other project* that loads the middleware gets this
application's defaults when the generator is run on a system with
everything installed (such as a dev box with devstack). Use the name
of the app instead, to ensure that the defaults are only set when this
app's sample config and documentation are being generated.

Change-Id: I6a8c7d44b9db9325003ff2fdb667b0ced7739e96
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
App name cannot be empty

Currently the POST call on apps does not check if the app name provided is
empty or not.

commit_message:
Decouple ceilometerclient without aodh services running

Currently, the ceilometerclient will be broken if aodh services not
running, it will be worse if users don't want alarming service and they
must start the aodh services.

Change-Id: Idf7468f28cee001262b67b6e110357ffc971535a
Closes-Bug: #1550095
(cherry picked from commit 78869fbccaffdf625fc1ec4ed3108bb7de892720)

commit_message:
Enhances client to support unique meter retrieval

meter list API is enhanced to support a unique param
If specified as True, it returns a unique list of
meters.

This patch enhances the ceilometer-client to support
the unique argument in the shell and the client bindings.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1506959

Change-Id: I011ca725c25e1cdbe9891c3719f13f5cd34142ea
(cherry picked from commit c45000c7594ad6fbfabf44c0615dce3021f43605)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/32/291832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self, q=None, limit=None, unique=False): params = [] if limit: params.append('limit=%s' % limit) if unique: params.append('unique=%s' % str(unique))
deleted_lines: def list(self, q=None, limit=None): params = ['limit=%s' % limit] if limit else None

commit_message:
Fixed delete policy bug while disabled events outstanding

Fixed simple misuse of theory name as theory object
Test added.

Also, on synchronization failure, log exception first before
calling delete_policy

Closes-Bug #1554707

Change-Id: Ie4a773a7ff6ec9fa3bcce2c873eaed98df5376e3

commit_message:
Add missing unit test for clean_command and fix error handling

The clean_command in barbican/model/clean.py is missing
a unit test for coverage. Unit tests have been added.

There was a redundant log exception that was removed.
A check for a successfull exit was removed because there are no
apparent exceptions that raise successfull exits during clean up.

Closes-Bug: #1555182
Change-Id: Ia1e1fe07dc9081b20c5fb0bad1a979809db0be4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/97/290697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.exception('Failed to clean up soft deletions in database.') repo.rollback() cleanup_total = 0 # rollback happened, no entries affected raise ex
deleted_lines: def _exception_is_successful_exit(thrown_exception): return (isinstance(thrown_exception, SystemExit) and (thrown_exception.code is None or thrown_exception.code == 0)) # TODO(edtubill) Make unit test for this method if not _exception_is_successful_exit(ex): LOG.exception('Failed to clean up soft deletions in database.') LOG.exception(ex.message) repo.rollback() cleanup_total = 0 # rollback happened, no entries affected raise ex

commit_message:
Add missing delay-release option in Fuel projects

By default if patch with Closes-Bug tag gets merged, bot changes bug
status to Fix Released.

We need a 'delay-release' option, so that bug will be moved to Fix
Commited state and then will be verified manually.

Change-Id: I90ced5a0643eaf9b9a2c2df530c25ed3b098c4a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/90/291390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: options: - delay-release options: - delay-release options: - delay-release options: - delay-release

Closes-Bug: #1556199

commit_message:
Fix programmatic error in heartbeat()

This patch is fixing a programmatic error in the heartbeat() method of
the APIClient() class. When 409 (Conflict) was returned from the the
Ironic API the code wasn't parsing the content of the response
correctly.

Change-Id: I01fbb8d866b2f94fe128d0bc40b69d05b5add1a3
Closes-Bug: #1556199
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/16/291816/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data = json.loads(response.content)
deleted_lines: data = response.json

commit_message:
Fixed command list

The cliff module expects an array of tuples however
the array that this function was returning was an array
of tuples that was also containing an array of values for
the commands attached to each group and the
cliff module wasn't liking it.

The output now comes out looking like:

| openstack.common | limits show |
|                  | extension list |
| openstack.baremetal.v1 | baremetal set |

Change-Id: Ifa1c149cb5c66ba27dc72bf72d7c8f2f50e42f73
Closes-Bug: 1545609

added_lines: commands = [] for group in groups: command_names = cm.get_command_names(group) for temp in command_names: commands.append((group, temp)) return (columns, commands)
deleted_lines: return (columns, ((c, cm.get_command_names(group=c)) for c in groups))

commit_message:
enable stack sudo for ironic discovery gate job

discovery_exercise.sh performs two steps that require superuser privileges:
* iptables -L ironic-inspector to confirm a node is not blacklisted before
  booting it for the discovery process
* virsh start <baremetal_domain> to trigger the discovery process of a node

This patch changes safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh behavior to avoid dropping
stack user from sudoers.d Similar approach has already been applied in case
of the nodepool.yaml set of jobs[1]

Links:
[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml#L77

Change-Id: I69fb19f4baa0ae433ac53a4384992ee6a9d3ba65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/64/291664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # discovery_exercise.sh requires iptables and virsh direct access export DEVSTACK_GATE_REMOVE_STACK_SUDO=0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary check for tenant information

Keystone v3 has changed the name of tenants to projects which means that
OS_TENANT_NAME is meaningless in a cloud where v3 is the default
authentication version. As such, if a user does not have OS_TENANT_NAME
enabled, cinderclient will not work even though it has checks for v3
immediately below this check (and the same check replicated further
below that). Removing this allows cinderclient to work with Keystone v3
without setting OS_TENANT_NAME unnecessarily.

Further, the check for project information was incorrectly referring to
project_domain_name and project_domain_id instead of
os_project_domain_name and os_project_domain_id.

Closes-bug: 1472636
Change-Id: Ifabb4a2aec070c00349e794364a71394feea99f1
(cherry picked from commit 8afc06c562ac8c189fae6ded7cc50f1b579f06c4)

commit_message:
Add __setitem__ to ImageTarget policy wrapper

Certain code paths expect that an ImageTarget class will use __setitem__ (as
it supports __getitem__) to set attributes on the target object. Since the
object does not presently support that, 500 exceptions are returned to users.

Closes-bug: 1533270
Closes-bug: 1533150
Change-Id: I41a618e096e458ec45c290b6412d67f215237f26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/77/269277/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __setitem__(self, key, value): """Set the value of 'key' on the target. :param str key: Attribute name to set :param value: Value to set to the attribute on the target """ key = self.key_transforms(key) setattr(self.target, key, value)

commit_message:
Missing info_cache.save() in db sqlalchemy api

'instance_info_cache_update' method is actually 'update_or_create'
method, so 'save' method is needed to add new value to the DB.

Closes-Bug: #1378459

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nathanael I Burton <nathanael.i.burton.work@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iab845de66b3cbb851134d9acb7b16c1b831d2bd4

commit_message:
Test no quota tests

Quota tests cause neutron to create new networks, which
wreaks havoc with the ZFS and LVM drivers because mounted
filesystems end up being stuck in other mount namespaces
created by neutron.

Depends-On: Ib1896997f2e7a505b5bf8ec0c9e5ee35942f79a6
Change-Id: I420cb60913e512527b23ef78b22cf834c660a4a4

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places.
Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.

commit_message:
Enable developer mode

This commit adds the ability to install neutron without a repo server.
This pattern is lifted from the os_keystone role and allows us to
further develop functional testing for this role.

Change-Id: I6a949ce79b7293efd1b966d253ee18f0339d87a4
Partial-Bug: #1553970

commit_message:
Add backwards compat for server_kwargs name change

9eb7f644 changed the 'server_kwargs' argument of
boot_and_delete_server_with_keypair to 'boot_server_kwargs', but
didn't add any backwards compatibility for it. This adds the necessary
compatibility in order to avoid breaking that scenario outright.

Change-Id: I1083a48d2f0cfbedb8dc35df475857313fabfd8d

commit_message:
Set the Swift max_file_size to 1/2 the loopback

Currently Devstack (and devstack gate) uses the default
max_file_size of for Swift (5GB). However the loopback file
is only 1 or 2 GB is size.

We are looking at setting a default FALLOCATE_RESERVE in swift
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/288011.
Because of this our max file size test fails due to the max_file_size
and devstacks loopback size being too small.

This patch sets this to a more sane size by default inside DevStack.
See the gerrit link above for more details.

Tempest uses a loopback of 6GB, so in this case the swift default of 5GB
should be fine.

Change-Id: If09eab7d16ae67bd252020e00e8812ff252f065b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/94/289194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set ``SWIFT_MAX_FILE_SIZE`` to configure the maximum file size in Swift API # Default 500MB because the loopback file used for swift could be 1 or 2 GB SWIFT_MAX_FILE_SIZE=${SWIFT_MAX_FILE_SIZE:-524288000} iniset ${SWIFT_CONF_DIR}/swift.conf swift-constraints max_file_size ${SWIFT_MAX_FILE_SIZE}

subject: Fix test_external_network_visibility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 06:23:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e491a45dae07a5bd746f2b52e7aec2358a83c7db', 'message': 'Fix test_external_network_visibility race

Fix I0219e17d2ec70939039344826d35cb533b3ce065 made it so
this test ignores shared external networks. However, it still
has a small race window because an external network could be
changed to shared by another concurrent test after this has
listed the network, but before it listed the subnets.

This adjusts the patch to instead ignore shared subnets on the
subnet-list call, which will ensure that no shared subnets
are included in the listing.

Change-Id: Iff3fba0d7e06fb26883cd9b64c57cadba9726af4
Related-Bug: #1553595
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 17:01:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/api/test_networks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f518c46477e544331c065a4f96789d567c46a488', 'message': "Fix test_external_network_visibility

The previous fix in I0219e17d2ec70939039344826d35cb533b3ce065
was boneheaded. It filtered the shared networks out of the
part of the test that wasn't affected by shared networks.

This corrects the test to ignore shared subnets in the subnet
list call.

Closes-Bug: #1553595
Change-Id: Iff3fba0d7e06fb26883cd9b64c57cadba9726af4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_external_network_visibility

The previous fix in I0219e17d2ec70939039344826d35cb533b3ce065
was boneheaded. It filtered the shared networks out of the
part of the test that wasn't affected by shared networks.

This corrects the test to ignore shared subnets in the subnet
list call.

Closes-Bug: #1553595
Change-Id: Iff3fba0d7e06fb26883cd9b64c57cadba9726af4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/66/289166/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: networks = [network['id'] for network in body['networks']] # we exclude any subnets that are shared from the listing since those # are meant to be visible body = self.client.list_subnets(shared=False)
deleted_lines: # shared external networks are excluded since their subnets are # visible networks = [network['id'] for network in body['networks'] if not network['shared']] body = self.client.list_subnets()

commit_message:
Event message format

Standardize on a message format which can be used across projects to push
events to users.

Change-Id: I9a5e60e26f2a16b9ae9b3ddfc6fc5d2b8660ed40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-specs refs/changes/82/231382/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ==================== Event Message Format ==================== Problem description =================== Currently Heat produces events related to status changes on resources, and contains error information in case of failure. Those events are stored in a table and only available by polling the API. They have a bunch of required fields, but are not versioned. We'd like to be able to push them to users, and make sure they can rely on the format over time by standardizing it and versioning it. Overall, most projects are faced with the issue of creating resources which take some time to appear, and thus requiring the users to poll their APIs. They would benefit from publishing such messages. Proposed change =============== The message envelope would have the following keys:: { "timestamp": "ISO8601 message creation time", "version": "SEMVER of the envelope schema type", "type": "Type of the message with a namespace", "id": "a UUID for the message so clients can dedup messages", "payload": { # Defined by the message type. Having a version here is strongly # recommended. }, # Optional "signature": "HMAC of the payload field" } For example:: { "timestamp": "2015-10-06T08:40:35", "version": "0.1", "type": "os.heat.event", "id": "9b3bf8dd-8afe-4de6-8c08-59fe8830b91f", "payload": { "stack_id": "05620183-fd51-48a1-990c-2df0efbe1cf3", "stack_name": "my-stack", "action": "CREATE", "status": "COMPLETE", "version": "0.1" } "signature": "b06aec9c83f4ccd5c354d191e2ecb50b" Alternatives ------------ `CADF <https://www.dmtf.org/standards/cadf>`_ provides a format for events, but is made for audit and contains a lot of information not relevant for this use cases. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: therve Work Items ---------- - Create a Oslo library to be able to format and validate such messages. - Adopt the format in Heat to publish events. Dependencies ============ None. References ---------- Previous discussions: - https://review.openstack.org/186436/ - https://review.openstack.org/185822/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

Take2: Only use screen when terminal is tty

Commit Ia661b4b56827bc07e86ab796d71db5f7528dc4ef did not properly
fix the detection of using the 'screen' formatter versus 'text'.
The default for the command line was always set to 'screen'.

Closes-Bug: #1551431

commit_message:
Update tempest plugin after tempest-lib deprecation

This is a combination of the following 2 commits.
(I combined them to pass the gate job.)

------
Update tempest plugin after tempest-lib deprecation

Closes-Bug: #1552598
Related: blueprint tempest-lib-reintegration
------
TrivialFix: Move from tempest to tempest.lib

As [1] has merged, to prevent future tempest gate failures,
we can move tempest to tempest.lib for the Network Client.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290108/
------

Co-authored-by: reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

commit_message:
Workaround for argparse update

pip tries to install new version of argparse on top of the already existent one and fails.

As a temporary fix we disable updates of already installed modules in tox configuration.

Related-Bug: #1536188

Change-Id: Ibed2dccacdce53f3d05f8e24a7144fc2bb4d3b9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/17/270817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}
deleted_lines: install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Single-Create Documentation

Since single-create utilizes the existing objects already documented, I added an
example for the request and response, and indicated to look for more details
in the appropriate object's section.

Change-Id: Icdf7f21867457e22086f9c44ab657f95617bee1a
Closes-Bug: #1551428

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard refs/changes/74/291874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - A new dashboard wizard for Neutron LBaaS version 2. Allows you to create a version 2 load balancer and related resources such as a listener, pool, pool members, and health monitor. - A view of all the existing version 2 load balancers. - Ability to view details of a version 2 load balancer and drill down to see details for the listener, pool, pool member, and health monitor resources. - Ability to create, update, and delete the version 2 load balancer, listener, pool, pool member, and health monitor resources. - Ability to associate and disassociate floating IP addresses for a version 2 load balancer. - Ability to choose from SSL certificates stored by the key-manager service when creating a version 2 listener using the TERMINATED_HTTPS protocol. - Ability to choose from existing instances from the compute service or specify external members when adding members to a version 2 pool.

commit_message:
Updating unit testing

Single create was accepted on the condition that some unit test coverage was
added afterward.  In testing I found a few errors involving the "pop" method,
and included those fixes here.

Closes-Bug: #1551427
Change-Id: If6dc8521ecf3bd194638f163e128fa2015320da8

commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I88af22c73543e4d96d2dbe5fc440e5d11738d927

commit_message:
raise exception on adding same rules with different literal order

currently, same rules with different literal order
are considered as diff rules if it has datasource tables. The
reason is while eliminating column references, we prepend the prefix
x_i for unnamed arguments, resulting in diff hash, hence diff rules.

This can be fixed either using the same prefix or by the sorting
the literals, which would be identified as same rules

This commit uses the same-prefix solution.

Change-Id: I4873de8be88894b28a4153a3d5bcb0cdefff9f9a
Closes-Bug:#1553430

commit_message:
tests: Add some basic compute_api tests for attaching volumes

It is really interesting that we never tested most of this logic even
though there is quite a bit of stuff going on. We only have some basic
tests in test_compute.py that do not check for different failure
conditions.

This patch adds some basic unit tests for the basic case of attaching a
volume to a non-shelved instance, and a failure to reserve a volume.

Change-Id: I6d3745dc17cd8534bd90c4d76448434bdc26ae83

commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I5903c864b049baaf354f4e4926f766dd77538d97

commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: Id1ea6224de9ea027ebda88c1de9e681f47e145d0

commit_message:
mysqld config: set innodb_file_per_table to ON

Innodb uses a single file by default, that may grow up to tens of
gigabytes.
This patch sets innodb_file_per_table option to ON so that db file can
be split.

Change-Id: Ia2a39a404d1cf01eb47e34aab88c3806bfb4844c
(cherry picked from commit 3270016dee72b3f9964e8d7d684f1440c2f10a24)

commit_message:
Set host in nova.conf for compute nodes

In order for instance HA to function safely, nova-compute needs access
to the name by which nova knows the current compute node.

Since the names of the nova-compute and neutron ml2 agents must be the
same for vif binding to work, it also sets the host value in
neutron.conf.

Change-Id: I7d07c57b7276815c72d08acaa86f673e43eb0498
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/66/288866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'DEFAULT/host': value => $fqdn;

commit_message:
Support the deployment of Ceph over IPv6

To deploy Ceph on IPv6, we need to enable ms_bind_ipv6 in addition
to passing the list of MON IPs in brackets.

Change-Id: I3644b8fc06458e68574afa5573f07442f0a09190
(cherry picked from commit 99cdabc403e5e9ff66182526ff6c577bdc1f9164)

commit_message:
Ansible role jobs copy console to disk not swift

We are having problems retrieving the entire ansible role job console
logs from swift via our logs.openstack.org wsgi service. While we debug
this problem switch these jobs to copy the console log to the disk based
server.

Change-Id: Ia9e89d79016e3fe782505343174b4e9f4a4e57eb

commit_message:
Add update_service()

Services can be updated, we can even update them!

Keystone v2.0 did not allow updates, Keystone v3 does

Improve unit tests to test v3 items for service functions

Change-Id: I36b9f92f7b551451973e3681dd8814ed90614b9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/04/287504/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ServiceUpdate(task_manager.Task): def main(self, client): return client.keystone_client.services.update(**self.args)

commit_message:
Update bandit.yaml

The bandit.yaml was out of date since new releases of bandit have
updated the file. This change brings the bandit.yaml up to date with
the 0.17.0 version of Bandit.

Change-Id: Ib5520df46c4eb153efa3736405445e198e6b5c58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/13/267113/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #plugins_dir: plugins# DEFAULT: \033[0m # HEADER: \033[95m # LOW: \033[94m # MEDIUM: \033[93m # HIGH: \033[91m# for example /tests/ - to remove all files in tests directoryblacklist_calls: qualnames: - pickle.loads - pickle.load - pickle.Unpickler - cPickle.loads - cPickle.load - cPickle.Unpickler message: > Pickle library appears to be in use, possible security issue. message: > Deserialization with the marshal module is possibly dangerous. - md5: qualnames: - hashlib.md5 - Crypto.Hash.MD2.new - Crypto.Hash.MD4.new - Crypto.Hash.MD5.new - cryptography.hazmat.primitives.hashes.MD5 message: Use of insecure MD2, MD4, or MD5 hash function. - ciphers: qualnames: - Crypto.Cipher.ARC2.new - Crypto.Cipher.ARC4.new - Crypto.Cipher.Blowfish.new - Crypto.Cipher.DES.new - Crypto.Cipher.XOR.new - cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms.ARC4 - cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms.Blowfish - cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms.IDEA message: > Use of insecure cipher {func}. Replace with a known secure cipher such as AES. level: HIGH - cipher_modes: qualnames: - cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.modes.ECB message: Use of insecure cipher mode {func}. message: Use of insecure and deprecated function (mktemp). message: > Use of possibly insecure function - consider using safer ast.literal_eval. message: > Use of mark_safe() may expose cross-site scripting vulnerabilities and should be reviewed. - httpsconnection: qualnames: - httplib.HTTPSConnection - http.client.HTTPSConnection - six.moves.http_client.HTTPSConnection message: > Use of HTTPSConnection does not provide security, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0033 message: > Use of unsafe yaml load. Allows instantiation of arbitrary objects. Consider yaml.safe_load(). - urllib_urlopen: qualnames: - urllib.urlopen - urllib.request.urlopen - urllib.urlretrieve - urllib.request.urlretrieve - urllib.URLopener - urllib.request.URLopener - urllib.FancyURLopener - urllib.request.FancyURLopener - urllib2.urlopen - urllib2.Request - six.moves.urllib.request.urlopen - six.moves.urllib.request.urlretrieve - six.moves.urllib.request.URLopener - six.moves.urllib.request.FancyURLopener message: > Audit url open for permitted schemes. Allowing use of file:/ or custom schemes is often unexpected. - random: qualnames: - random.random - random.randrange - random.randint - random.choice - random.uniform - random.triangular message: > Standard pseudo-random generators are not suitable for security/cryptographic purposes. level: LOW - telnetlib: qualnames: - telnetlib.* message: > Telnet-related funtions are being called. Telnet is considered insecure. Use SSH or some other encrypted protocol. level: HIGH # Most of this is based off of Christian Heimes' work on defusedxml: # https://pypi.python.org/pypi/defusedxml/#defusedxml-sax - xml_bad_cElementTree: qualnames: - xml.etree.cElementTree.parse - xml.etree.cElementTree.iterparse - xml.etree.cElementTree.fromstring - xml.etree.cElementTree.XMLParser message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_ElementTree: qualnames: - xml.etree.ElementTree.parse - xml.etree.ElementTree.iterparse - xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring - xml.etree.ElementTree.XMLParser message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_expatreader: qualnames: [xml.sax.expatreader.create_parser] message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_expatbuilder: qualnames: - xml.dom.expatbuilder.parse - xml.dom.expatbuilder.parseString message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_sax: qualnames: - xml.sax.parse - xml.sax.parseString - xml.sax.make_parser message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_minidom: qualnames: - xml.dom.minidom.parse - xml.dom.minidom.parseString message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_pulldom: qualnames: - xml.dom.pulldom.parse - xml.dom.pulldom.parseString message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. - xml_bad_etree: qualnames: - lxml.etree.parse - lxml.etree.fromstring - lxml.etree.RestrictedElement - lxml.etree.GlobalParserTLS - lxml.etree.getDefaultParser - lxml.etree.check_docinfo message: > Using {func} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {func} with its defusedxml equivalent function. subprocess: - subprocess.Popen - subprocess.call - subprocess.check_call - subprocess.check_output - utils.execute - utils.execute_with_timeout shell: - os.system - os.popen - os.popen2 - os.popen3 - os.popen4 - popen2.popen2 - popen2.popen3 - popen2.popen4 - popen2.Popen3 - popen2.Popen4 - commands.getoutput - commands.getstatusoutput no_shell: - os.execl - os.execle - os.execlp - os.execlpe - os.execv - os.execve - os.execvp - os.execvpe - os.spawnl - os.spawnle - os.spawnlp - os.spawnlpe - os.spawnv - os.spawnve - os.spawnvp - os.spawnvpe - os.startfile level: HIGH message: > A telnet-related module is being imported. Telnet is considered insecure. Use SSH or some other encrypted protocol. - info_libs: imports: [pickle, cPickle, subprocess, Crypto] level: LOW message: > Consider possible security implications associated with {module} module. # Most of this is based off of Christian Heimes' work on defusedxml: # https://pypi.python.org/pypi/defusedxml/#defusedxml-sax - xml_libs: imports: - xml.etree.cElementTree - xml.etree.ElementTree - xml.sax.expatreader - xml.sax - xml.dom.expatbuilder - xml.dom.minidom - xml.dom.pulldom - lxml.etree - lxml message: > Using {module} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace {module} with the equivalent defusedxml package. level: LOW - xml_libs_high: imports: [xmlrpclib] message: > Using {module} to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Use defused.xmlrpc.monkey_patch() function to monkey-patch xmlrpclib and mitigate XML vulnerabilities. level: HIGH hardcoded_tmp_directory: tmp_dirs: [/tmp, /var/tmp, /dev/shm] # Support for full path, relative path and special "%(site_data_dir)s" # substitution (/usr/{local}/share) word_list: "%(site_data_dir)s/wordlist/default-passwords" - PROTOCOL_SSLv2 - SSLv2_METHOD - SSLv23_METHOD - PROTOCOL_SSLv3 # strict option - PROTOCOL_TLSv1 # strict option - SSLv3_METHOD # strict option - TLSv1_METHOD # strict option try_except_pass: check_typed_exception: True

Allows instantiation of arbitrary objects. Consider yaml.safe_load()." - urllib_urlopen: qualnames: [urllib.urlopen, urllib.urlretrieve, urllib.URLopener, urllib.FancyURLopener, urllib2.urlopen, urllib2.Request] message: "Audit url open for permitted schemes. Allowing use of file:/ or custom schemes is often unexpected." subprocess: [subprocess.Popen, subprocess.call, subprocess.check_call, subprocess.check_output, utils.execute, utils.execute_with_timeout] shell: [os.system, os.popen, os.popen2, os.popen3, os.popen4, popen2.popen2, popen2.popen3, popen2.popen4, popen2.Popen3, popen2.Popen4, commands.getoutput, commands.getstatusoutput] no_shell: [os.execl, os.execle, os.execlp, os.execlpe, os.execv,os.execve, os.execvp, os.execvpe, os.spawnl, os.spawnle, os.spawnlp, os.spawnlpe, os.spawnv, os.spawnve, os.spawnvp, os.spawnvpe, os.startfile] level: ERROR message: "Telnet is considered insecure. commit_message:
Use tempest.lib instead of tempest_lib

Recent change in tempest migrated to tempest.lib instead of tempest-lib
and soon tempest_lib will be deprecated.
Ref: db9672e3473cd6046f269d63435e102a477d8cdd
This commit is to update the same.

Change-Id: Ifd8a79bdaf98d56dbb1855a7ce02888eb65840a3

commit_message:
Material theme form errors - fix red text on red bg

How to Test:
1. Go to Identity > Projects > Create Project modal
2. Don't fill out any fields and click submit button
3. Look at help-block

*Now matches error styling on ng-Launch Instance wizard

Change-Id: I79e0d9ed8acb86da8bf31c5010f90e79c763f983
Closes-Bug: #1555833

commit_message:
Use dd to create swapfile, ensure swap amount == 8GB

It is not possible to use a swapfile generated by fallocate on a
xfs filesystem which is shipped by default on CentOS >7.
So since [1], we effectively ran jobs on CentOS VMs without any
swap.
Use dd as a way of creating the swapfile that works on both Ubuntu
and CentOS with a slight performance hit and ensure it's mounted
properly so we don't have a silent failure.

Also manage a new specific case, Vexxhost VMs ship with 2GB of swap
which is not in line with the expectation that all VMs should have
8GB. If there is less than 8GB of swap (or zero), we will make up
for the difference.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278557/

Change-Id: Iaf4de66475d747f62bd49dfe7318131cbeb03be8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/76/290776/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure virtual machines from different providers all have at least 8GB of # swap. # Use an ephemeral disk if there is one or create and use a swapfile. # Rackspace also doesn't have enough space on / for two devstack installs, SWAPSIZE=8192 swapcurrent=$(( $(grep SwapTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{ print $2; }') / 1024 )) if [[ $swapcurrent -lt $SWAPSIZE ]]; then sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary linux-swap 1 ${SWAPSIZE} swapdiff=$(( $SWAPSIZE - $swapcurrent )) sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=${swapfile} bs=1M count=${swapdiff}
deleted_lines: # HPCloud and Rackspace performance nodes provide no swap, but do have # ephemeral disks we can use. For providers with no ephemeral disks, such # as OVH or Internap, create and use a sparse swapfile on the root # filesystem. # HPCloud also doesn't have enough space on / for two devstack installs, if [ `grep SwapTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{ print $2; }'` -eq 0 ]; then sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary linux-swap 1 8192 sudo fallocate -l 8192M ${swapfile}

commit_message:
Add missing node to puppet-cookiecutter check

This job had no node declaration and thus always fails. Add
devstack-centos7 like other puppet jobs.

Change-Id: Ie2cf470578abd8e35fa58241d48fda83f97dcfee

commit_message:
Create default archive policies out of the box

This creates default archive policies configuration
out of the box when the database is empty.

Change-Id: I1c20bc618b9eed4e8a5c8554d5484325a7aac01e
Closes-bug: #1538872
(cherry picked from commit b477e4e114a26606e05939a8eb0ced81bdeebc71)

commit_message:
Remove openstack-pkg-tools build dependency

For the moment, we don't need the openstack-pkg-tools scripts for
builds.  As a result, we need to add get-orig-source target.

Change-Id: Ic9bfd1b1fa43837e213f823be049f3e3b28ce17c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
DRBD: Policy-based waiting for completion

The more nodes are in a cluster, the higher the chance that one or more
of them are not available. Waiting on all nodes will not work any more,
so give the user a way to define what conditions are acceptable (to the
management, etc.) to continue.

The upcoming DRBDmanage 1.0 release will have a (sample) policy plugin,
so make that available in Cinder, too.
Documentation is at
    http://drbd.linbit.com/users-guide-9.0/s-drbdmanage-deployment-policy.html

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib2bc888ca5df87a4de97ee07601d0280a04c7a81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/07/287807/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

This patch removes the bandit.yaml and just uses the defaults. As
such there are a few flagged issues that needed correcting.

The hits are now marked with "# nosec" so that they'll be ignored
since the hits were not security-related.

Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eric Brown <browne@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ib253a4a21156b6606c356ade46c72c6ace01a1af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/16/267116/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except KeyError: # nosec # This option is not known to auth_token. v is not converted.
deleted_lines: except KeyError: # This option is not known to auth_token.

commit_message:
Use new devstack-logs publisher

Instead of pasting all the logs onto the console, we can now have them
saved seperately by the devstack-logs publisher.

Add "|| true" rescue commands to the chef-client invocations, so that
rake will continue to run through to the save_logs even if the chef run
fails.

Change-Id: I475509d770e90da38ba76d4fe126d6610ef280e2

commit_message:
Missing dependency for domain config.

When using "domain_config_directory", the /etc/keystone directory is
expected to be present.  This require the package to be present.  This
bit add this missing dependency.

Change-Id: Ia358f70560a7e45a848e5d4d29685f464591511c
Closes-Bug: 1555534

Fix manila devstack plugin for keystone v3 usage

A devstack run with a keystone v3 only setup (ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2=False)

commit_message:
Prevent IP conflicts on lxcbr0

We assign IPs to the containers from the dhcp range handled by lxc. This
could cause random failures due to IP conflicts on this range.

Adjusting the dhcp range for lxc and adjusting the assigned IPs for
containers to fall outside of that range resolves this.

Change-Id: I1b2f5c9645959875c5ac500b4799517a3b041d71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/67/291767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove use of old bandit.yaml

The bandit.yaml in use by Barbican was very old. This patch removes
it and just uses the default provided by Bandit itself. Some issues
needed to be fixed or ignored as a result.

Change-Id: If35c5d8173b9d86617647028a30b0548bb03d3c0

deleted_lines: bandit -c bandit.yaml -r barbican -n5 -p barbican_conservativecommands = bandit -c bandit.yaml -r barbican -n5 -p barbican_conservative

commit_message:
Set TCP keepalive options

The following configuration options are in the sample config
but are not used:

- tcp_keepalive
- tcp_keepidle
- tcp_keepalive_interval
- tcp_keepalive_count

Use the utility function from oslo_utils to set the socket options.

Change-Id: I38f501202184792f12bf153a800e39a4b1a3fccb
Closes-Bug: #1554022
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/96/289296/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import netutils netutils.set_tcp_keepalive( dup_socket, tcp_keepalive=CONF.tcp_keepalive, tcp_keepidle=CONF.tcp_keepidle, tcp_keepalive_interval=CONF.tcp_keepalive_interval, tcp_keepalive_count=CONF.tcp_keepalive_count )
deleted_lines: # sockets can hang around forever without keepalive dup_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_KEEPALIVE, 1)

REVIEWERS NOTE: Some work still in progress to remove events that are
no longer needed by the actions.

The Angular images actions now consistently return a promise. This allows
a view to fetch an image related action from the registry, call it, and
have a consistent way to know that it is complete.

Promises are preferred over events because they require less setup
and teardown, better handle the asynchronous nature of modal actions
and don't require a parent-child scope relationship.

Future patches may add data to the promise so that the view can know
which items were affected by the action, but for now a simple reload
of the items displayed is fast and good enough.

Change-Id: Ib065ad622d1fa9c324a523baebb9b304aecc8945
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Images Actions Return Promises

REVIEWERS NOTE: Some work still in progress to remove events that are
no longer needed by the actions.

The Angular images actions now consistently return a promise. This allows
a view to fetch an image related action from the registry, call it, and
have a consistent way to know that it is complete.

Promises are preferred over events because they require less setup
and teardown, better handle the asynchronous nature of modal actions
and don't require a parent-child scope relationship.

Future patches may add data to the promise so that the view can know
which items were affected by the action, but for now a simple reload
of the items displayed is fast and good enough.

Change-Id: Ib065ad622d1fa9c324a523baebb9b304aecc8945
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Workaround for oslo duplicate config issue

Providing sample config instead of generating it,
since config generation is running into trouble
as outlined in the bug description.

This is a workaround till we identify the root
cause of the issue and address it.

Change-Id: Ide4cbbe711a5c48fd1ff93251037c0b8b16f385d
Related-Bug: #1555788

commit_message:
Restructuring the Quickstart guide

We need the gcc and other dependencies
installed before we can do any tox related
commands.

Installation of git was never checked in QSG.
I happened to create a baremetal CentOS server
with minimal install and there was no git.
Added steps to install git.

Moved the steps related to git clone and other
kolla configuration after basic installation.
since tox fails for gcc.

In the quickstart guide we are generating
the configuration using tox but tox is not
installed before doing so. Adding steps to
install tox before generating conf.

Change-Id: Ic8a756e66d33963e47607ed60c4c768e0859152d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/73/291573/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Install tox and generate the build configuration :: pip install tox

subject: Enable os_net_config to configure IVS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 02:53:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/bdb3b736255c72c053f1bae3757e43dad2698dde', 'message': "Enable os_net_config to configure IVS

This change generates /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-* for ivs.
It also generates /etc/sysconf/ivs configuration file for ivs.
It supports only RedHat in this change.

Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS, https://github.com/floodlight/ivs)
is a virtual switch for Linux. It is compatible with the KVM
hypervisor and leveraging the Open vSwitch kernel module for
packet forwarding. There are three main difference between IVS
and OVS:
1. Each node can have at most one ivs, name is not required.
2. Bond is allowed to attach to an ivs. It is the SDN controller's
job to dynamically form bonds on ivs.
3. IP address can only be statically assigned.

Change-Id: I276d736794d123405de793c2a4eb2c1ee55a0fad

commit_message:
Enable os_net_config to configure IVS

This change generates /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-* for ivs.
It also generates /etc/sysconf/ivs configuration file for ivs.
It supports only RedHat at this point.

Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS, https://github.com/floodlight/ivs)
is a virtual switch for Linux. It is compatible with the KVM
hypervisor and leveraging the Open vSwitch kernel module for
packet forwarding. There are three major differences between
IVS and OVS:
1. Each node can have at most one ivs, name is not required.
2. Bond is not allowed to attach to an ivs. It is the SDN
controller's job to dynamically form bonds on ivs.
3. IP address can only be statically assigned.

Change-Id: I276d736794d123405de793c2a4eb2c1ee55a0fad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/92/274492/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif obj_type == "ivs_bridge": return IvsBridge.from_json(json) elif obj_type == "ivs_interface": return IvsInterface.from_json(json) self.ivs_bridge_name = None # internalclass IvsInterface(_BaseOpts): """Base class for ivs interfaces.""" def __init__(self, device, vlan_id, use_dhcp=False, use_dhcpv6=False, addresses=None, routes=None, mtu=1500, primary=False, nic_mapping=None, persist_mapping=False, defroute=True, dhclient_args=None, dns_servers=None): addresses = addresses or [] routes = routes or [] dns_servers = dns_servers or [] name = '%s%i' % (device, vlan_id) super(IvsInterface, self).__init__(name, use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, primary, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) self.vlan_id = int(vlan_id) numbered_nic_names = _numbered_nics(nic_mapping) if device in numbered_nic_names: self.device = numbered_nic_names[device] else: self.device = device @staticmethod def from_json(json): device = json.get('device') vlan_id = _get_required_field(json, 'vlan_id', 'IvsInterface') opts = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json(json) return IvsInterface(device, vlan_id, *opts) class IvsBridge(_BaseOpts): """Base class for IVS bridges. Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS) is a virtual switch for Linux. It is compatible with the KVM hypervisor and leveraging the Open vSwitch kernel module for packet forwarding. There are three main difference between IVS and OVS: 1. Each node can have at most one ivs, no name needed. 2. physical port and internal port can be attached to an ivs. No bond is allowed attached to it. It is the SDN controller's job to dynamically form bonds on ivs. 3. IP address can only be statically assigned. """ def __init__(self, name='ivs', use_dhcp=False, use_dhcpv6=False, addresses=None, routes=None, mtu=1500, members=None, nic_mapping=None, persist_mapping=False, defroute=True, dhclient_args=None, dns_servers=None): addresses = addresses or [] routes = routes or [] members = members or [] dns_servers = dns_servers or [] super(IvsBridge, self).__init__(name, use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, False, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) self.members = members for member in self.members: member.ivs_bridge_name = name member.ovs_port = False self.primary_interface_name = None # ivs doesn't care primary intf @staticmethod def from_json(json): name = 'ivs' (use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json( json, include_primary=False) members = [] # members members_json = json.get('members') if members_json: if isinstance(members_json, list): for member in members_json: members.append(object_from_json(member)) else: msg = 'Members must be a list.' raise InvalidConfigException(msg) return IvsBridge(name, use_dhcp=use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6=use_dhcpv6, addresses=addresses, routes=routes, mtu=mtu, members=members, nic_mapping=nic_mapping, persist_mapping=persist_mapping, defroute=defroute, dhclient_args=dhclient_args, dns_servers=dns_servers)

commit_message:
Consistent resource.prop for timestamps and booleans (compute)

This patch set updates all compute objects to use consistent
resource.prop for timestamps and booleans. In particular, the
following changes were made:
  - Clarify documentation for timestamp and boolean attributes
  - Use 'is_' prefix and boolean type for boolean attributes
  - Use '_at' suffix and timestamp type for timestamp attributes

Change-Id: I6dbb946dad0d9daee5fd766fab6577e9701edb35
Partial-Bug: #1544584

subject: Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 01:46:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/280d0fa8e82ee4491fe6681c57e2c7214baab559', 'message': "Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate

During evacuate a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

Since the above fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch), also add 'instance_host' to
to the connector when we detect that the instance host is
different from the connector host. With this additional
information, cinder drivers can be fixed to do the right
thing when the instance host does not match the connector
host.

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Closes-Bug: #1522496

During evacuate a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

Since the above fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch), also add 'instance_host' to
to the connector when we detect that the instance host is
different from the connector host. With this additional
information, cinder drivers can be fixed to do the right
thing when the instance host does not match the connector
host. Cinder drivers rely on various parts of the connector
to properly terminate, but if that is not reliable some
drivers can discover this information given the volume
and host.

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Closes-Bug: #1522496
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-29 22:15:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/26842bc9e70b600ebe4222c20049940eab5c8d1c', 'message': "Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate

During evacuate a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

This fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch) because existing attachments
don't have the connector stashed in the bdm.connection_info.
In cases where the original connector was not saved leave
the behavior as-is.

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Closes-Bug: #1522496

commit_message:
Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate

During evacuation a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

This fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch) because existing attachments
don't have the connector stashed in the bdm.connection_info.
In cases where the original connector was not saved, leave
the behavior as-is.

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Partial-Bug: #1522496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/266095/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If the volume is attached to another host (evacuate) then # this connector is for the wrong host. Use the connector that # was stored in connection_info instead (if we have one). # Also add the instance host to the connector so cinder can figure # things out either way. try: instance_host = instance.get('host') if connector.get('host') != instance_host: connection_info = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info) if connection_info: connector = connection_info.get('connector') or connector connector['instance_host'] = instance_host except Exception as e: LOG.debug('_detach_volume attempt to fix connector raised: %s.', six.text_type(e))

commit_message:
Should not raise Exception before connection close

Currently VmdkReadHandle.close() raises a VimException before
the read connection is closed, this patch let's add a `finally`
to close it.

Change-Id: Ib5b388f7eeb9f26de66c308a89f70c85ba6dc7a9

commit_message:
Decouple ceilometerclient without aodh services running

Currently, the ceilometerclient will be broken if aodh services not
running, it will be worse if users don't want alarming service and they
must start the aodh services.

Change-Id: Idf7468f28cee001262b67b6e110357ffc971535a
Closes-Bug: #1550095

commit_message:
Enhances client to support unique meter retrieval

meter list API is enhanced to support a unique param
If specified as True, it returns a unique list of
meters.

This patch enhances the ceilometer-client to support
the unique argument in the shell and the client bindings.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1506959

Change-Id: I011ca725c25e1cdbe9891c3719f13f5cd34142ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/33/272633/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self, q=None, limit=None, unique=False): params = [] if limit: params.append('limit=%s' % limit) params.append('unique=%s' % (str(unique)) if unique else '')
deleted_lines: def list(self, q=None, limit=None): params = ['limit=%s' % limit] if limit else None

commit_message:
make aggregation-method argument as a mandatory field

When create the gnocchi alarm, the aggregation-method is required.

Closes-Bug: #1531602
Change-Id: I65b5038053d69dc727639fbfeaa5a23108845083

commit_message:
Adding method "__setitem__"  for class "ImageTarget"

Fix 500 error when got again image data with caching.
It happens for the reason cache middleware couldn't assign
value to image_meta['size'] because it expects a dictionary
(as it was in v1 api), but in v2 api it's ImageTarget object.

Change-Id: I2281a0174a032aa00d9fb51ebdb88c5ac228d163
Closes-bug: #1533270
