commit_message:
Mock swiftclient's functions in tests

swiftclient changed their code so if the chuck size is greater than
zero it will return a generator otherwise it will return the response.
Which would be the object you are looking for.  This causes our tests
to fail since they are always expecting the response instead of a
generator.

Closes-bug: 1556059

Co-Authored-by: avarner <avarner@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I62cc037493af87373a75e37e2d9f33b8aedf9889

commit_message:
Add option for nova endpoint type

When the neutron notification to nova was updated to use novaclient the
nova_url parameter was disabled.  This prevents administrators from
using anything but the publicURL as the proper endpoint to notify nova.
This patch adds an option to pass on to novaclient for the
endpoint_type so that the administrator can set the notification url to
public, internal or admin.

Change-Id: I405f761944449cab6b8c8895f98419f79cd74cad
Closes-Bug: #1478471
DocImpact: Need to add a new option to the neutron configuration
reference.

commit_message:
fullstack: increase test timeout

Database teardowns seem to have a lock contention issue.  This is a
workaround.

Change-Id: Ifd0957a86646c6a13a71b5bbf985f4694e37e943
Partial-bug: 1541742

commit_message:
Forcibly clear parameters now passed as parameter_defaults

The previous version of the client used to pass the Heat template
parameters in the 'parameters:' section while the newer versions
use 'parameter_defaults:' but those won't override what was
passed previously because on update we use 'existing: true'.

Closes-Bug: 1554564
Change-Id: Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
Depends-On: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
DeploymentGraph merged tasks and own tasks getters are separated

There was no method to get own Cluster deployment graph. (Used for
cluster-level customization)

So the get_deployment_tasks method of Cluster objects was
separated into get_deployment_tasks what returning merged graph and
get_own_deployment_tasks that returning only cluster-level deployment tasks.

Change-Id: Iced0a9c00b8f9204e2ae90e3cb1772365698cd85
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

The option was used to enable experimental Artifacts API
that was moved to glance-glare service. This config option
does not do anything and is removed to avoid confusion.

Closes-bug: 1556050

commit_message:
Remove unused enable_v3_api config option

The option was used to enable experimental Artifacts API
that was moved to glance-glare service. This config option
does not do anything and is removed to avoid confusion.

Removed apropriate sections from example config files as well.

Change-Id: Ie84f3f65ec88fd30197758ac319ef5b2f4c313e2
Closes-bug: 1556050
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/87/291687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: def test_set_default_hugepages(self): fake_hugepages = ['0', '1', '2', '3'] node = mock.Mock( attributes={ 'hugepages': { 'nova': {}}}, meta={ 'numa_topology': { 'supported_hugepages': fake_hugepages}} ) objects.Node._set_default_hugepages(node) expected = dict((x, 0) for x in fake_hugepages) self.assertDictEqual(expected, node.attributes['hugepages']['nova']) def test_get_total_hugepages(self): node = mock.Mock( attributes={ 'hugepages': { 'comp1': {'value': { '2048': '14', '1048576': '2'}}, 'comp2': {'value': { '1048576': '25'}}}}) expected = { '2048': 14, '1048576': 27} self.assertDictEqual( expected, objects.Node.get_total_hugepages(node)) def test_hugepages_kernel_opts(self): node = mock.Mock( attributes={ 'hugepages': { 'comp1': {'value': { '1048576': '2'}}, 'comp2': {'value': { '2048': '15'}}}}) expected = "hugepagesz=2M hugepages=15 hugepagesz=1G hugepages=2" self.assertEqual( expected, objects.Node.get_hugepages_kernel_opts(node))

commit_message:
Fix inst.repo / inst.ks kernel parameters for Anaconda for USB boot

Adjusted as hd:LABEL:/ source are not suitable for installation from
usb drive because Anaconda searching for ISO file with repo.
Installation will fail if iso file can't be found. So we
change `repo` to cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ and `ks` to
cdrom:OpenStack_Fuel:/ks.cfg both for cdrom and usb installation.

Also `repo` and `ks` kernel parameters changed to `inst.repo` and `inst.ks`

Change-Id: Icaf51417daa2426aa3714daa7a38d3c18b989de6
Related-Bug: #1540862

deleted_lines: " repo=%(repo)s\n"

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT APIs may get too little data

There are a few API calls in the NetApp cDOT driver where
the default value of 20 records in iterator queries isn't
overridden and is potentially too low in some deployments.
This commit resolves the issue by adding a generic getter
API pagination wrapper and using that for all appropriate
API calls.

Change-Id: Ia05ac6be2f84bb0db3adf458fb399187be0b2635
Closes-Bug: #1500255

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Deployment ========================= Add 'type' attribute to deployment. Problem description =================== With ability to usue Rally not only for OpenStack we have to be able to distinguish deployments not only by name or UUID, but by type (OpenStack, Amazon etc) Proposed change =============== Add 'type' attribute to deployment, that well be automaticaly set by deployment engine. Alternatives ------------ None comes to mind. Implementation ============== * add 'deployment_type' column to deployment model * add 'deployment_type' attribute to deployment engines * add 'type' conlumn to `rally deployment list` output table During deployment create value of engine's 'deployment_type' have to be whitten in deployment model. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: oanufriev aka Oleh Anufriiev Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None.

commit_message:
Get rid of fake tasks for test_deletion_during_deployment

Concurrent fake threads for tasks in test_deletion_during_deployment
cause deadlocks in the database.
Affected tests are rewritten to send notifications directly
using NailgunReceiver call.

Change-Id: I1484be9ce560d321b8a9e021dfc7f9bec696eef0
Closes-Bug: #1554319
Related-Bug: #1541005

added_lines: from nailgun.rpc.receiver import NailgunReceiver @fake_tasks(recover_nodes=False, fake_rpc=False) def test_deletion_during_deployment(self, mock_rpc): NailgunReceiver.provision_resp( task_uuid=deploy_uuid, status=consts.TASK_STATUSES.running, progress=50, ) task_delete = self.db.query(models.Task).filter_by( cluster_id=cluster_id, name="cluster_deletion" ).first() NailgunReceiver.remove_cluster_resp( task_uuid=task_delete.uuid, status=consts.TASK_STATUSES.ready, progress=100, )
deleted_lines: import unittest2 @unittest2.skip("Randomly failing test") @fake_tasks(recover_nodes=False) def test_deletion_during_deployment(self): def cluster_is_deleted(): q = self.db.query(models.Cluster).filter_by(id=cluster_id) return not self.db.query(q.exists()).scalar() self.env.wait_for_true(cluster_is_deleted, error_message="Cluster deletion timeout")

commit_message:
Fix stack preview

Don't execute translation rule for property that contains
a GetParam function that can't be resolved at the moment.
Such situation happens when we try to resolve get_param function
that refer to parameter with None value. We receive parameter value
from parent stack, where this value is a reference to some resource
without resource_id, so this situation is legal for stack preview
and we shouldn't fail. Note, that we can reproduce this behaviour
only with resources with hidden parameters and overrided  get_resource_id
method, that returns None if resoruce creation has not been started yet.

Change-Id: Ia1097940db983721c8b5116db7ee0a2c4c45339d
Closes-Bug: #1548802

commit_message:
Fix outdated noop rspec tests

Fix some outdated rspec tests to make them work properly with
more recent fixture.

Disabled integration tests since this patch affects noops only.

Change-Id: I6c369cdc0262d7a681deda2a5a9ac58bdcea7136
Fuel-CI: disable
Partial-bug: #1535339

commit_message:
tests: disable process monitor before managers

Otherwise the monitor may respawn managers later, leaving them running.

Issue spotted in:
http://logs.openstack.org/02/216902/4/check/gate-neutron-dsvm-functional/a97df90

Change-Id: I0e68b06c87b5770756fdf7b9201e1986cc67e07b
Related-Bug: #1490051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/221211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._process_monitor.stop()

commit_message:
virt: refactor method compute_driver_matches

We only use method compute_driver_matches for checking if compute_driver
equals 'xenapi.XenAPIDriver'. To be explicit, just rename it to is_xenapi.

Change-Id: I2fb61491c4a321ab430f39476127412d8ee17c0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/263243/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_xen = driver.is_xen()
deleted_lines: is_xen = driver.compute_driver_matches('xenapi.XenAPIDriver')

subject: Prevent any property change from replacing OS::Nova::Server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 06:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud_heat_plugins/server_update_allowed.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/b1dda77a9d2e0e0deb6954528d51abcd0d511668', 'message': 'Prevent any property change from replacing OS::Nova::Server

This change ensures that any property change in an OS::Nova::Server
resource will not result in the server being replaced. This is a more
complete approach to only protecting servers from changes to the
user_data property - upgrades testing have also shown replacement issues
with other properties such as scheduler_hints.

Change-Id: I6127ca9c3abb57c025df7d039c03bb7e64efad2c
Related-Bug: #1539541
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent any property change from replacing OS::Nova::Server

This change ensures that any property change in an OS::Nova::Server
resource will not result in the server being replaced. This is a more
complete approach to only protecting servers from changes to the
user_data property - upgrades testing have also shown replacement issues
with other properties such as scheduler_hints.

Change-Id: I6127ca9c3abb57c025df7d039c03bb7e64efad2c
Related-Bug: #1539541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/73/288273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '''Prevent any properties changes from replacing an existing server. update_allowed_properties = server.Server.properties_schema.keys()
deleted_lines: from heat.engine import properties '''Allows the user_data property to be changed on update without replacement. properties_schema = dict(server.Server.properties_schema) properties_schema[server.Server.USER_DATA] = properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, 'User data script to be executed by cloud-init.', update_allowed=True, default='' )

commit_message:
Pass public_addr to ceph::profile::params instead of ceph::mon

The ceph::mon resource is a define not a class so the hieradata is
not applied transparently; this change passes it to
ceph::profile::params instead which is a class.

Change-Id: Ia6518b769feb147f862b67915432d1bb7b47a415
Depends-On: I56f969328c68ed83a9b2d54ff4254dbcd6f55de0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/80/280380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: ceph::mon::public_addr: {get_input: ceph_public_ip}

commit_message:
Fix port attach/detach notifications

Only notify concerned agent (host) when port is attached/detached (Disable
notifications fanout) on correct topic

Change-Id: Ie371d63e6bdd0600e86e7d31f601b61bea3d7157
(cherry picked from commit 6c14f58d4e83b0adb6afbd6ca323d0cc27a2604f,
and commit c96cf424a0e6bd58bc2ee46b7e0ef2c0a290755c)

deleted_lines: 'topic': '%s.%s' % (self.topic_bagpipe_update, host), fanout=True) # TODO(tmorin): per-host topics # topic = '%s.%s' % (self.topic_bagpipe_update, host) # cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic, fanout=True) # fanout=False?

subject: Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 22:32:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/4858d377c5d4ae0cc65c724dd6b374839a450880', 'message': "Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

Closes-Bug: #1533861
Change-Id: Iab9f0e4b4dd337363dd7e705c1155f3f6517b404
(cherry picked from commit 543d577613a5ccc12f4482d9e2f9ce1f29db21b4)
(cherry picked from commit 40004ebbca6c345da09cec4e91f85fc73ab18e70)

commit_message:
Fix tests to work under both pymsysql 0.6.2 and 0.7.x

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'
exc.params = {tuple} (1, 2)

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'
exc.params = {dict} {'id': 1, 'foo_id': 2}

So the easiest thing to support both is to use string interpolation
and then check if they are equal. This approach works for both py34
and py27 as well. Note that we still have to test the old way for
sqlite which has (?, ?) in the SQL statement.

NOTE(tonyb): We need to make the same change in
.../old_import_api/.../test_exc_filters.py in the stable/kilo branch.
This was removed in the liberty timeframe in
If3036e03a68c2e865b5f0495c74fe8303de93d21

Closes-Bug: #1533861
Change-Id: Iab9f0e4b4dd337363dd7e705c1155f3f6517b404
(cherry picked from commit 543d577613a5ccc12f4482d9e2f9ce1f29db21b4)
(cherry picked from commit 40004ebbca6c345da09cec4e91f85fc73ab18e70)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/72/291472/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if params is not None: if '?' in exc.statement: self.assertEqual(exc.statement, sql) self.assertEqual(exc.params, params) else: self.assertEqual(exc.statement % exc.params, sql % params) else: self.assertEqual(exc.statement, sql)
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(exc.statement, sql) if params is not None: self.assertEqual(exc.params, params)

commit_message:
fix swift measure reporting

swift measures count is returned as unicode. we need to ensure it's
passed to API as integer.

Change-Id: Ie502aa218715763b595d17536c3eddbc8c5b892f

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from neutron.common import constants from neutron.common import topics from neutron import context from neutron.extensions import portbindings from neutron.extensions import providernet as pnet from neutron.plugins.ml2 import config from neutron.plugins.ml2 import managers from neutron.plugins.ml2 import rpc from neutron.tests.common import helpers from neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2 import test_plugin from networking_bagpipe.driver.type_route_target import TYPE_ROUTE_TARGET import networking_bagpipe.rpc.client as bagpipe_rpc HOST = 'bagpipe_host' HOST_2 = HOST + '_2' HOST_3 = HOST + '_3' NOTIFIER = 'networking_bagpipe.rpc.client.BaGPipeAgentNotifyAPI' DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE = 'compute:None' def _get_linuxbridge_agent_dict(host, agent_type, binary, bridge_mappings=None, interface_mappings=None): agent = { 'binary': binary, 'host': host, 'topic': constants.L2_AGENT_TOPIC, 'agent_type': agent_type, 'start_flag': True} if bridge_mappings is not None: agent['configurations']['bridge_mappings'] = bridge_mappings if interface_mappings is not None: agent['configurations']['interface_mappings'] = interface_mappings return agent def register_linuxbridge_agent(host=HOST, agent_type=constants.AGENT_TYPE_LINUXBRIDGE, binary='bagpipe-linuxbridge-agent', bridge_mappings=None, interface_mappings=None): agent = _get_linuxbridge_agent_dict(host, agent_type, binary, bridge_mappings, interface_mappings) return helpers._register_agent(agent) class TestBaGpipeRpcTestCase(test_plugin.Ml2PluginV2TestCase): _mechanism_drivers = ['bagpipe'] def setUp(self): config.cfg.CONF.set_override('type_drivers', TYPE_ROUTE_TARGET, 'ml2') config.cfg.CONF.set_override('tenant_network_types', TYPE_ROUTE_TARGET, 'ml2', enforce_type=True) super(TestBaGpipeRpcTestCase, self).setUp() self.adminContext = context.get_admin_context() self.type_manager = managers.TypeManager() self.notifier = bagpipe_rpc.BaGPipeAgentNotifyAPI(topics.AGENT) self.callbacks = rpc.RpcCallbacks(self.notifier, self.type_manager) net_arg = {pnet.NETWORK_TYPE: TYPE_ROUTE_TARGET, pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID: '101'} self._network = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'net1', True, arg_list=(pnet.NETWORK_TYPE, pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID,), **net_arg) net_arg = {pnet.NETWORK_TYPE: TYPE_ROUTE_TARGET, pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID: '102'} self._network2 = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'net2', True, arg_list=(pnet.NETWORK_TYPE, pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID,), **net_arg) cast = ('networking_bagpipe.rpc.client.BaGPipeAgentNotifyAPI.' '_notification_host') cast_patch = mock.patch(cast) self.mock_cast = cast_patch.start() def _register_ml2_agents(self): register_linuxbridge_agent(host=HOST) register_linuxbridge_agent(host=HOST_2) register_linuxbridge_agent(host=HOST_3) def test_attach_port_on_bagpipe_network_called(self): self._register_ml2_agents() with self.subnet(network=self._network) as subnet: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port1: p1 = port1['port'] s1 = subnet['subnet'] device = 'tap' + p1['id'] p1_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p1['fixed_ips']] s1_cidr = s1['cidr'][s1['cidr'].index('/'):] expected = {'id': p1['id'], 'network_id': p1['network_id'], 'mac_address': p1['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p1_ips[0] + s1_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s1['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:101', 'export_rt': '64512:101' } } self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device) self.mock_cast.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected, HOST) def test_attach_port_on_bagpipe_network_called_two_agents(self): self._register_ml2_agents() with self.subnet(network=self._network) as subnet: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST, 'admin_state_up': True} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID, 'admin_state_up',), **host_arg) as port1: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST_2, 'admin_state_up': True} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID, 'admin_state_up',), **host_arg) as port2: p1 = port1['port'] s1 = subnet['subnet'] device1 = 'tap' + p1['id'] p1_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p1['fixed_ips']] s1_cidr = s1['cidr'][s1['cidr'].index('/'):] expected1 = {'id': p1['id'], 'network_id': p1['network_id'], 'mac_address': p1['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p1_ips[0] + s1_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s1['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:101', 'export_rt': '64512:101' } } p2 = port2['port'] device2 = 'tap' + p2['id'] p2_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p2['fixed_ips']] expected2 = {'id': p2['id'], 'network_id': p2['network_id'], 'mac_address': p2['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p2_ips[0] + s1_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s1['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:101', 'export_rt': '64512:101' } } expected_calls = [ mock.call(mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected1, HOST), mock.call(mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected2, HOST_2) ] self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device1) self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST_2, device=device2) self.mock_cast.assert_has_calls(expected_calls) def test_attach_port_on_bagpipe_network_called_two_networks(self): self._register_ml2_agents() with self.subnet(network=self._network) as subnet: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST_2} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port1: with self.subnet(network=self._network2, cidr='10.0.1.0/24') as subnet2: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST} with self.port(subnet=subnet2, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port2: p1 = port1['port'] s1 = subnet['subnet'] device1 = 'tap' + p1['id'] p1_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p1['fixed_ips']] s1_cidr = s1['cidr'][s1['cidr'].index('/'):] expected1 = {'id': p1['id'], 'network_id': p1['network_id'], 'mac_address': p1['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p1_ips[0] + s1_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s1['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:101', 'export_rt': '64512:101' } } p2 = port2['port'] s2 = subnet2['subnet'] device2 = 'tap' + p2['id'] p2_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p2['fixed_ips']] s2_cidr = s2['cidr'][s2['cidr'].index('/'):] expected2 = {'id': p2['id'], 'network_id': p2['network_id'], 'mac_address': p2['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p2_ips[0] + s2_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s2['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:102', 'export_rt': '64512:102' } } expected_calls = [ mock.call(mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected1, HOST_2), mock.call(mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected2, HOST) ] self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST_2, device=device1) self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device2) self.mock_cast.assert_has_calls(expected_calls) def test_delete_port(self): self._register_ml2_agents() with self.subnet(network=self._network) as subnet: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port: p1 = port['port'] device1 = 'tap' + p1['id'] self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device1) with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port2: p2 = port2['port'] device2 = 'tap' + p2['id'] self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device2) self._delete('ports', port2['port']['id']) expected = {'id': p2['id'], 'network_id': p2['network_id'], } self.mock_cast.assert_any_call( mock.ANY, 'detach_port_from_bagpipe_network', expected, HOST) def _update_and_check_portbinding(self, port_id, host_id): data = {'port': {'binding:host_id': host_id}} req = self.new_update_request('ports', data, port_id) res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, req.get_response(self.api)) self.assertEqual(host_id, res['port']['binding:host_id']) def _test_host_changed(self, twice): self._register_ml2_agents() helpers.register_dhcp_agent() with self.subnet(network=self._network) as subnet: host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST} with self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg) as port1: p1 = port1['port'] s1 = subnet['subnet'] device1 = 'tap' + p1['id'] p1_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p1['fixed_ips']] s1_cidr = s1['cidr'][s1['cidr'].index('/'):] expected1 = {'id': p1['id'], 'network_id': p1['network_id'], 'mac_address': p1['mac_address'], 'ip_address': p1_ips[0] + s1_cidr, 'gateway_ip': s1['gateway_ip'], 'evpn': {'import_rt': '64512:101', 'export_rt': '64512:101' } } expected_calls = [ mock.call(mock.ANY, 'attach_port_on_bagpipe_network', expected1, HOST) ] self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device1) self.mock_cast.assert_has_calls(expected_calls) if twice: self._update_and_check_portbinding(p1['id'], HOST_3) self._update_and_check_portbinding(p1['id'], HOST_2) expected1 = {'id': p1['id'], 'network_id': p1['network_id']} expected_calls = [ mock.call(mock.ANY, 'detach_port_from_bagpipe_network', expected1, HOST) ] self.mock_cast.reset_mock() self.callbacks.get_device_details(self.adminContext, device=device1, agent_id=HOST_2) self.mock_cast.assert_has_calls(expected_calls) def test_host_changed(self): self._test_host_changed(twice=False) def test_host_changed_twice(self): self._test_host_changed(twice=True)

commit_message:
Forcibly clear parameters now passed as parameter_defaults

The previous version of the client used to pass the Heat template
parameters in the 'parameters:' section while the newer versions
use 'parameter_defaults:' but those won't override what was
passed previously because on update we use 'existing: true'.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py
	tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py

Closes-Bug: 1554564
Change-Id: Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
Depends-On: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f4ce6893e3a6a5849ca3312ed06569d217704375)

commit_message:
IPv6: pass bracketed IP to rabbitmq puppet module

Without this, rabbitmq initialization can fail because it doesn't use
the URI format of the IP address:

Error: curl -k --noproxy localhost --retry 30 --retry-delay 6 -f -L -o
/var/lib/rabbitmq/rabbitmqadmin
http://guest:guest@fd00:fd00:fd00:2000::12:15672/cli/rabbitmqadmin
returned 7 instead of one of [0]

Change-Id: Iaa7e2f503a101462d481f5263b398290377467f3

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/57/275157/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================== Integrate murano with DevStack ============================== You can install murano with DevStack. The `contrib/devstack`_ directory contains the files necessary to integrate murano with `DevStack`_. Enable murano in DevStack ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. Download DevStack: .. code-block:: console git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack cd devstack #. Edit ``local.conf`` to enable murano devstack plugin: .. code-block:: console > cat local.conf [[local|localrc]] enable_plugin murano git://git.openstack.org/openstack/murano #. If you want to enable Murano Cloud Foundry Broker API service, add the following line to ``local.conf``: .. code-block:: ini enable_service murano-cfapi #. (Optional) To import murano packages when DevStack is up, define an ordered list of FQDN packages in ``local.conf``. Verify that you list all package dependencies. These packages will be imported from the ``murano-apps`` git repository by default. For example: .. code-block:: ini MURANO_APPS=io.murano.apps.apache.Tomcat,io.murano.apps.Guacamole To configure the git repository that will be used as the source for the imported packages, configure the ``MURANO_APPS_REPO`` and ``MURANO_APPS_BRANCH`` variables. #. Install DevStack: .. code-block:: console ./stack.sh **Result:** DevStack with murano is installed. .. Links .. _Devstack: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/ .. _contrib/devstack: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/murano/tree/contrib/devstack

subject: Meta values evaluation was fixed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 12:53:53.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/TestMeta.yaml', 'murano/dsl/murano_property.py', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_method.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_meta.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_type.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_package.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/188315377b2718bf5f4057ef86811ec7b0af8cd4', 'message': 'Meta values evaluation was fixed

Meta property values were not evaluated.
As a result property value 4 considered to be an integer
but 2+2 to be a string "2+2". This commit fixes 2 things:

1) Adds evaluation to property values making embedded
    YAQL expressions to be evaluated
2) Changes the contexts on which Meta is calculated. Before
    This fix everything was done in caller context thus value
    of the local variables of functions where Meta was accessed
    could be used in Meta definitions

Change-Id: I50de9199e5efa36a668fd3640a016a723326cae7
Closes-Bug: #1555617
'}]
commit_message:
Meta values evaluation was fixed

Meta property values were not evaluated.
As a result property value 4 considered to be an integer
but 2+2 to be a string "2+2". This commit fixes 2 things:

1) Adds evaluation to property values making embedded
    YAQL expressions to be evaluated
2) Changes the contexts on which Meta is calculated. Before
    This fix everything was done in caller context thus value
    of the local variables of functions where Meta was accessed
    could be used in Meta definitions

Change-Id: I50de9199e5efa36a668fd3640a016a723326cae7
Closes-Bug: #1555617

subject: Rewrite node creating and updating code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 15:39:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-cloud-config/commit/c6962028ec68015c11406fe6446dc9a965d0d9f0', 'message': "[WIP] Rewrite node creating and updating code

This change started as an attempt to stop hardcoding ironic properties,
but turns out a lot of things need fixing. Highlights:
* Stop hardcoding flavor (e.g. agent, pxe) for each driver
* Support only generic properties with pm_* names. Driver-specific things
  should stay with their prefix. Existing pm_* driver-specific things
  were deprecated.
* Pass through everything that starts with driver-specific prefix to
  node's driver_info.
* Dropped handling Conflict exceptions - ironicclient is doing it for
  some time already (and does better job in it).
* Issue a specific exception for malformed instackenv.json.
* Use 'add' operation instead of 'replace', as it allows both adding
  and overwriting (despite its name).
* Fixed some small issues like adding a dict to a set.

Change-Id: Id3fb1a20e9790ce7e45f1fac97ddea4f8edc8ac3
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 12:12:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-cloud-config/commit/8cd06b0482ce4b247d326e9025c50b2f391c6432', 'message': "[WIP] Rewrite node creating and updating code

This change started as an attempt to stop hardcoding ironic properties,
but turns out a lot of things need fixing. Highlights:

commit_message:
Rewrite node creating and updating code

This change started as an attempt to stop hardcoding ironic properties,
but turns out a lot of things need fixing. Highlights:
* Stop hardcoding flavor (e.g. agent, pxe) for each driver
* Support only generic properties with pm_* names. Driver-specific things
  should stay with their prefix. Existing pm_* driver-specific things
  were deprecated.
* Pass through everything that starts with driver-specific prefix to
  node's driver_info.
* Dropped handling Conflict exceptions - ironicclient is doing it for
  some time already (and does better job in it).
* Issue a specific exception for malformed instackenv.json.
* Optimize calls to ironic (use list with details instead of list+get)
* Use 'add' operation instead of 'replace', as it allows both adding
  and overwriting (despite its name).
* Fixed some small issues like adding a dict to a set.

Change-Id: Id3fb1a20e9790ce7e45f1fac97ddea4f8edc8ac3

added_lines: import contextlibimport shutilimport tempfile @contextlib.contextmanager def update_cpio(img_path, dir_path=None): tmp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=dir_path) try: with subprocess.popen( ["gunzip", "-c", img_path], stdout=subprocess.PIPE) as proc: subprocess.call( ["cpio", "-id"], stdin=proc.stdout, cwd=tmp_dir) yield tmp_dir tmp_dir_len = len(tmp_dir) with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(dir=dir_path) as new_img: with subprocess.popen( ["cpio", "--format", "newc", "-o"], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, cwd=tmp_dir) as cpio: with subprocess.popen( ["gzip", "-c"], stdin=cpio.stdout, stdout=new_img, cwd=tmp_dir): for path, _, files in os.walk(tmp_dir): for f_name in files: f_path = os.path.join(path, f_name) f_path = ".{0}".format(f_path[tmp_dir_len:]) cpio.stdin.write("{0}\n".format(f_path)) cpio.stdin.close() shutil.move(new_img.name, img_path) new_img.delete = False finally: shutil.rmtree(tmp_dir)

commit_message:
Fix status update for replicas

When an error is raised by a driver during
the update_replica_state loop in the
manager, it will break out of the loop
and not update the other replicas. This change
has the manager set that replica's "replica_state"
and "status" to ERROR instead of raising an exception,
then continue checking the other replicas.

Closes-Bug: 1554270
Change-Id: I6df8d0a4c5f3a7304d51ae97f710f4faf61a5adb

commit_message:
Setup tftp for all scenarios

Currently tftp is only set up when ironic is setup for standalone
usage. This is incorrect. tftp is required for all use cases.

Change-Id: Ic47b71c0d9113d128d547247045a03cad4c20c82

commit_message:
Enable notifications on undercloud

Configure notifications for Keystone, Glance, Nova, Heat, and Neutron.

This allows users to listen on the notification bus for things like
resource tracking and monitoring.

Change-Id: I3f0324f4632e1e3e5bac8b4c1d256251c8bb806c
(cherry picked from commit c77ad7855935bd6737394c149da7af3c6d0ca350)

commit_message:
Remove tempest duplicate copy of skip_unless_attr

tempest.lib has decorator skip_unless_attr which has been moved
to tempest_lib and now it is already moved to tempest.lib

This commit removes the duplicate copy of this decorator from api/utils.py

"""Common utilities used in testing.""" from tempest import test class skip_unless_attr(object): """Decorator that skips a test if a specified attr exists and is True.""" def __init__(self, attr, msg=None): self.attr = attr self.message = msg or ("Test case attribute %s not found " "or False") % attr def __call__(self, func): def _skipper(*args, **kw): """Wrapped skipper function.""" testobj = args[0] if not getattr(testobj, self.attr, False): raise test.BaseTestCase.skipException(self.message) func(*args, **kw) _skipper.__name__ = func.__name__ _skipper.__doc__ = func.__doc__ return _skipper

subject: Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 09:00:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/driver.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_exception_serialization.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/notify/_impl_log.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/bb4121a465d99d15bd33693833fdc9e94b07f0f8', 'message': 'Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"

This reverts commit bd81d09c02c5bc8561ad04de91802a5c1917d9e9.

I understand that the change was supposed to fix something, but instead it broke all tests on Python 3!?

It's wrong to replace blindly json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(). In oslo messaging, the result is usually used as a value in a dictionary, and then the whole dictionary is passed to a second serializer which also serialize to JSON.

Sorry, I don't understand everything, but at least I see that tests passed on py3 before the change, and started to fail with the change.

Maybe json(utils).dumps() is misused in some places, but in this case, you should write a change which only fix these specific places, not replace all calls to dumps().

Change-Id: Icd54ee8e3f5c976dfd50b4b62c7f51288649e112
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure the json result type is bytes on Python 3"

This reverts commit bd81d09c02c5bc8561ad04de91802a5c1917d9e9.

I understand that the change was supposed to fix something, but instead it broke all tests on Python 3!?

It's wrong to replace blindly json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(). In oslo messaging, the result is usually used as a value in a dictionary, and then the whole dictionary is passed to a second serializer which also serialize to JSON.

Sorry, I don't understand everything, but at least I see that tests passed on py3 before the change, and started to fail with the change.

Maybe json(utils).dumps() is misused in some places, but in this case, you should write a change which only fix these specific places, not replace all calls to dumps().

Change-Id: Icd54ee8e3f5c976dfd50b4b62c7f51288649e112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/09/291609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: json_data = jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(data) failure = jsonutils.loads(data) _MESSAGE_KEY: jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(raw_msg)}

subject: Increase partitioning logic period
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 13:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/b0f5df4fed38c40df5876a2bcdb5f7c673765481', 'message': "Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
(cherry picked from commit d87048d34693bc3ee45b8fa152f133070f9c3f7f)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
(cherry picked from commit d87048d34693bc3ee45b8fa152f133070f9c3f7f)

commit_message:
xenapi: fix when tar exits early during download

When downloading a streamed chunk from swift through glance gives tar
invalid input, tar will exit, but leave the plugin still trying to write
data to the dead process.

To stop this we can spot when the tar process exits early, and be sure
to stop trying to write more data to the dead process.

Change-Id: Ic2bc89fa6d08db505b044a9498c1bfa5b884a056
Closes-Bug: 1552293

Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places.
Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.

commit_message:
Enable IPA debug logging during introspection when undercloud_debug is True

This is done by setting ipa-debug=1 in the kernel command line.

Change-Id: I6e3dc7b82c11f1438d4ec2151546ab648f70821a
(cherry picked from commit b4e54ef782fa60f0e6a8f4ad3fd9be58bcde8b9b)

commit_message:
Install rake lint when no Gemfile is found

With the move to ubuntu-trusty, puppet projects without
a Gemfile started to fail due to rake not being installed.

Install rake on this case, as well as needed dependencies
to run contents inside Rakefile.

Change-Id: I39168815bd89eb09a5085edd587184e3f72dfeae

commit_message:
Strip "\n" character from result

domain-create command never succeed when the backend is NSD4.

"self._command(command)" returns not "ok" but "ok\n".

Result is now stripped of the "\n" character
Closes-Bug: #1537688

Change-Id: Iddd4f4abc1cdd116f8b7b1e50dcff134c6f2214b

commit_message:
[docs] Add code block types into docstrings

Most our docstrings are used for auto-generation docs, so it would be
nice to mark code blocks with correct identifiers.

Also, this patch fixes next issues:
 - CobblerProvider: json doesn't support comments
 - OpenStackProvider: Remove "\n" from json since docutils transforms it
   to new line.
Change-Id: Ia3762dc00e093b1bc0669f55032f5224db625bcd

subject: Fix unstable DB migration tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/utils.py', 'manila/tests/db/migrations/alembic/test_migration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/37c6e3179f96c6cd22b357030eee7a4218f3becd', 'message': "Fix unstable DB migration tests

Unit test 'test_walk_versions' in
'manila.tests.db.migrations.alembic.test_migration' module
takes abnormally very long time sometimes.
In common cases it takes about 5-10 seconds in CI for Mitaka set of
DB migrations.
In CI runs when this test fails, 'postgres' variant takes
about 47 seconds and mysql reaches common test timeout of 60 seconds.

Note, that this test becomes slower with each
addition of new DB migration. Also, 'pymysql' works much slower
on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'.

So, add new test decorator that sets individual test timeout.
And make it be 5 minutes for mentioned test. In worst case of Mitaka
DB migrations set it can take about 2 minutes, but make it bigger
to have a margin for future releases.

Change-Id: I233f96f29fe62231c2e7013b74c06396dd923f27
Closes-Bug: #1501272
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unstable DB migration tests

Unit test 'test_walk_versions' in
'manila.tests.db.migrations.alembic.test_migration' module
takes abnormally very long time sometimes.
In common cases it takes about 5-10 seconds in CI for Mitaka set of
DB migrations.
In CI runs when this test fails, 'postgres' variant takes
about 47 seconds and mysql reaches common test timeout of 60 seconds.

Note, that this test becomes slower with each
addition of new DB migration. Also, 'pymysql' works much slower
on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'.

So, add new test decorator that sets individual test timeout.
And make it be 5 minutes for mentioned test. In worst case of Mitaka
DB migrations set it can take about 2 minutes, but make it bigger
to have a margin for future releases.

Change-Id: I233f96f29fe62231c2e7013b74c06396dd923f27
Closes-Bug: #1501272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/97/291397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila.tests import utils as test_utils # NOTE(vponomaryov): set 5 minutes timeout for case of running it on # very slow nodes/VMs. Note, that this test becomes slower with each # addition of new DB migration. On fast nodes it can take about 5-10 secs # having Mitaka set of migrations. # 'pymysql' works much slower on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'. And such # timeout mostly required for testing of 'mysql' backend. @test_utils.set_timeout(300) @test_utils.set_timeout(300)

commit_message:
Allow the containerized compute node to spawn larger VMs

Atomic's root partition & logical volume defaults to 3G.
In order to launch larger VMs, we need to enlarge the root
logical volume and scale down the docker_pool logical volume.
We are allocating 80% of the disk space for vm data and the
remaining 20% for docker images.

Change-Id: If3fff78f476de23c7c51741a49bae227f2cdfe3e
Co-authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/288822/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Atomic's root partition & logical volume defaults to 3G. In order to launch # larger VMs, we need to enlarge the root logical volume and scale down the # docker_pool logical volume. We are allocating 80% of the disk space for # vm data and the remaining 20% for docker images. ATOMIC_ROOT='/dev/mapper/atomicos-root' ROOT_DEVICE=`pvs -o vg_name,pv_name --no-headings | grep atomicos | awk '{ print $2}'` growpart $( echo "${ROOT_DEVICE}" | sed -r 's/([^0-9]*)([0-9]+)/\1 \2/' ) pvresize "${ROOT_DEVICE}" lvresize -l +80%FREE "${ATOMIC_ROOT}" xfs_growfs "${ATOMIC_ROOT}" cat <<EOF > /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage-setup GROWPART=true AUTO_EXTEND_POOL=yes POOL_AUTOEXTEND_PERCENT=30 POOL_AUTOEXTEND_THRESHOLD=70 EOF

commit_message:
Use service tenant for ceilometer

Configure ceilometer to use the service tenant instead of the admin
tenant.  Using the admin tenant is not required and a security risk.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: Ia14695eb23a1ff551fd27f74b4cb864e80b100e3
Partial-Bug: #1358237
(cherry picked from commit 0d47b4d27f2f114fae6d88fd9efaf9fb28f6e052)

Define context.roles with base class

In Ia575ba803a0fb70f39146bd75d381ed19414bd23, oslo.context (2.2.0)
added roles support in the context itself. This passing roles as to

commit_message:
Pass identity/auth uris to "openstack::ceilometer"

Key moments:
  * don't modify config manually
  * ceilometer::agent::auth write this options to config
  * override keystone_auth_uri/keystone_identity_uri defaults
    in "openstack::ceilometer"

Change-Id: I6f8d88a0416c2610db290a60b98e62e51911842a
Closes-bug: #1551332

deleted_lines: ceilometer_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_uri' : value => $keystone_auth_uri; 'keystone_authtoken/identity_uri' : value => $keystone_identity_uri; }

commit_message:
Skip test_volume_backed_live_migration()

This test has been flaky in the multi-node jobs. Let's skip it for now
so we can make progress with live migration work.

This test failed 24 times in the last 24 hours and suceeded 21 times
according to logstash.

Change-Id: I65c181f922aedb3819a529d16040eb467f2e5b21
Related-bug: #1549511

commit_message:
Upgrades: quiet yum upgrade on cinder nodes

Yum update on cinder nodes should be quiet, as it is on controllers,
because results of these updates are sent to Heat. I mistakenly left
this out in the first patch because i used one of the standalone node
upgrade scripts as a copy/paste base for the cinder node upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id13190dc4d242317829c7994088183f52d21461d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/73/291173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: yum -y -q update
deleted_lines: yum -y update

commit_message:
disable swift retry

swift has native retry functionality built in and it's enabled by
default. this means every action we do, even those expected to failed,
will repeat 5 times with an additional backoff mechanism. so every
time we have a new metric, there is quite a large delay between first
attempt and confirmation that it does not exist

Change-Id: I4320fb3e8bb30603bd70f8159fbcf855fc4a2880
(cherry picked from commit b66e1fadf2a510541f3e337ce8417112a81077ed)

deleted_lines: timeout=conf.swift_timeout)

commit_message:
Fix arg for "Port already exists" error

Ironic port list with provided mac address returns list with one
element, in case port exist. So always get uuid from 0 port.

Closes-Bug: #1555498
Change-Id: I9729e1a0fb158b80ba9b7260e43814bd9ad206d8

commit_message:
cpu_allocation_ratio / ram_allocation_ratio options

The cpu_allocation_ratio option allows specifying what the ratio of virtual
CPUs to physical CPUs should be on a compute node.

The ram_allocation_ratio option allows specifying what the ratio of virtual ram
to to physical ram should be on a compute node.

Change-Id: I13e0015589c4435cf34ec57c0bfad38cddc41e44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/34/290534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :cpu_allocation_ratio => '32.0', :ram_allocation_ratio => '2.0', it { is_expected.to contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/cpu_allocation_ratio').with(:value => '32.0') } it { is_expected.to contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/ram_allocation_ratio').with(:value => '2.0') }

commit_message:
Revert "cpu_allocation_ratio / ram_allocation_ratio options"

This causes the tripleo undercloud install to fail and presumably
other deployments where nova::scheduler::filter and
nova::compute are being used together.

This reverts commit e4c3b0ff1c96430efea3815135e07bbb8323d881.
Closes-Bug: #1556041

Remove the resource tracker resource on terminate

When an instance is terminated, the resources can be released
in the host tracker.

Fixes bug 1227925

commit_message:
Remove soft_deleted filter in image cache manage

soft_deleted should not be considered because nova
can't remove the backend image file if the instance
is soft_deleted, otherwise it can lead to problem
when restore operation is triggered.

Change-Id: I5225bba278f02e8aba2f646db22ec00f54479eb0
Partial-Bug: 1484847

subject: Increase partitioning logic period
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 14:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/d87048d34693bc3ee45b8fa152f133070f9c3f7f', 'message': "Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738
"}]
commit_message:
Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

Change-Id: Ie7b114a1c8f55e7291057e8193172c4f188a2f61
Closes-Bug: #1554738

commit_message:
Fix URL for storage endpoint when ceph enabled

There is wrong endpoint URL(IP instead of domain name) at the keystone
when fuel deploys environment with ceph enabled.

Replace IP with domain name for object storage endpoint.

Change-Id: Ia883e9364a72960fa29e92764a40971faba72d41
Closes-bug: #1546483

commit_message:
Rename tox-nodb-ENV to tox-ENV

Use again tox-ENV as standard tox job instead of tox-nodb-ENV.
The old tox-ENV job was bare-trusty based and can get removed now.

Change-Id: I837e02dc74c5860235b1a58e9a304fdaec281c2e

commit_message:
Improve murano modals js hooks

Use new addModalInitFunction horizon js function instead of pushing the
function to private array inside horizon.modals
Calls init functions in case element is found on the page and it's not
modal.

Fixes ':' placement in related form

Related-Bug: #1550822

Change-Id: I65c281dbe52ac6e9dc22722baca32a955397d771
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/52/290452/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon.modals.addModalInitFunction(muranoUploadBundle); function muranoUploadBundle(modal) { var uploadForm = $(modal).find('#import_bundle');
deleted_lines: horizon.modals._init_functions.push(muranoUploadBundle); function muranoUploadBundle() { var uploadForm = $('#import_bundle');

commit_message:
DHCP: Downgrade 'network has been deleted' logs

These will happen all of the time as networks are quickly
created/updated and then deleted. It's not any kind of
actionable warning condition so this patch downgrades them
to debug.

Change-Id: Idcfb185b9a0540c13101dceb3681132f38f1716c
Closes-Bug: #1555842
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/291480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Network %s has been deleted.", network.id) LOG.debug('Network %s has been deleted.', network_id)
deleted_lines: LOG.warning(_LW("Network %s has been deleted."), network.id) LOG.warning(_LW('Network %s has been deleted.'), network_id)

subject: Clean Upstream CentOS repos which comes with centos-release pkg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 14:58:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/16abac02ea983ed6fcb48a9dcb3d836b05fa1fff', 'message': "Change installation order for additional packages in rpm sandbox

We install sequentially additional packages into RPM chroot which
required for building RPM. We need to postpone @buildsys-build
group installation since it brings upstream mirrors to yum:

  package: epel-release.noarch 7-5
  dependency: redhat-release >= 7
   provider: centos-release.x86_64 7-2.1511.el7.centos.2.10

So this patch introduces changes:
 * remove yum from installation list, since it's already installed
 * change order and install yum-utils first and then
   @buildsys-build

Upstream mirrors from centos-release will be removed on the next
step

Change-Id: I274f3e3675d327c700262058682200d7781ff1b9
Related-bug: #1541871
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-09 15:32:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/aad68ea16a2caa67f1ce443e7d59aa3569a55188', 'message': 'Change installation order for additional packages in rpm sandbox

We sequentially install additional packages into RPM chroot which
required for building RPM. We need to install them in a "single
yum transaction", because each of the package by itself brings
upstream mirrors into chroot (by dependency centos-release)

Change-Id: I274f3e3675d327c700262058682200d7781ff1b9
Related-bug: #1541871
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-09 15:33:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/b677d3cc6d14c0700acda7df92da54a194b83c48', 'message': 'Change installation order for additional packages in rpm sandbox

Change-Id: I274f3e3675d327c700262058682200d7781ff1b9
Related-bug: #1541871
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-10 09:43:56.000000000', 'files': ['sandbox.mk'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/2e7b44e1d88df34cd2aca1c6fa7c6df10454d176', 'message': 'Clean Upstream CentOS repos which comes with centos-release pkg

We need to clean RPM chroot each time on installing packages from
$(SANDBOX_PACKAGES), since some of them can "bring" centos-release
as dependency

Change-Id: I274f3e3675d327c700262058682200d7781ff1b9
Related-bug: #1541871
'}]
commit_message:
Clean Upstream CentOS repos which comes with centos-release pkg

We need to clean RPM chroot each time on installing packages from
$(SANDBOX_PACKAGES), since some of them can "bring" centos-release
as dependency

Change-Id: I274f3e3675d327c700262058682200d7781ff1b9
Related-bug: #1541871
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/65/277865/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/rpm/buildd.tar.gz: SANDBOX_PACKAGES:=yum-utils @buildsys-build
deleted_lines: $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/rpm/buildd.tar.gz: SANDBOX_PACKAGES:=@buildsys-build yum yum-utils

commit_message:
Allow non-admins to define "external" extra-routes

Currently non-admin users can create extra-routes when the nexthop is on
router-interfaces subnets but not on external-network subnet. Indeed
user permissions are used to get router ports in order to validate
nexthops BUT non-admin users don't "see" router port on its external
network.

This change uses an elevated context instead of user context to enable
non-admins to create "external" extra-routes.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I08b1d8586a4cd241a3589e8cb7151b77ab679124

commit_message:
Change default host reserved memory to 2048MB from 512MB

Results from pmap of idle nova-compute:
  https://gist.github.com/jtaleric/addd9079d6cdf4f7cf42

Results from free -m and cat /proc/meminfo:
  https://gist.github.com/jtaleric/410130f09c2aad2dc7e9

bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1282644
Change-Id: I9b3ceecabfdae0a516cfc72886fde7b26cc68f82
(cherry picked from commit 79e84f35b46e561d5f2d0a744d07c10285adecab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/46/291446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Changing the default from 512MB. The current templates can not deploy # overclouds with swap. On an idle compute node, we see ~1024MB of RAM # used. 2048 is suggested to account for other possible operations for # example openvswitch. nova::compute::reserved_host_memory: 2048

commit_message:
Change the CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm

Previously we used to always set CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm from
the client. With [1] we aim at cleaning up the client from any
default so this change move the actual default into the templates.

1. Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680

Change-Id: I662e4b0e3cf909ec2583d087ca1d246715caf0f7
Related-Bug: 1554564
(cherry picked from commit 7f2bca677bbffdd1a3031709fcc9d6f0bac48bb7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/291654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: lioadm
deleted_lines: default: tgtadm

commit_message:
Fix iteration over network_providers

"networks_metadata" dictionary contains not only network providers.
So iteration over all it's keys is incorrect.

Related to blueprint support-dpdk

Change-Id: Iae565914a8cef6ef77076c6cfee4045c1c164ab5

commit_message:
Configure nova to use custom scheduler filter

The dependency adds a new scheduler filter that is required for
predictable placement of nodes.  This simply configures Nova to
use the new filter.

Change-Id: Ie25d2aacf3b496fd5f02071adc5b2e09e37a8684
Depends-On: I0618a3b9e3c33af7cdc78db4b6994d463b8aeda9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/88/288188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_available_filters: 'tripleo_common.filters.list.tripleo_filters' nova::scheduler::filter::scheduler_default_filters: 'RetryFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,CapabilitiesFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,DiskFilter,ComputeFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter,ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter,ServerGroupAffinityFilter'

commit_message:
Ops guide rst conversion

Just ran through pandoc, placed into source.

New tox env for building rst created, and assorted required files to
make sphinx happy.

bmoss: fixed tables, TOC, a lot of things that pandoc does not
convert correctly.

Implements: blueprint ops-guide-rst
Change-Id: If0ee4a2d7ed5821543cc3820d573e5b73dad07e3

commit_message:
Update of CI Infra config files

CI Infra software was updated to latest version.
Current config files are outdated and non-working,
updating configs for:
	-jenkins jobs
	-nodepool
	-zuul
Structure of directories is also changed as required by
upstream CI Infra deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Iab8ff8c680b2e486f70f77b3a2ff69bd43f9b7c4

commit_message:
DeploymentGraph SQLAlchemy models relations declaration cleaned 2

All relations to ClusterDeploymentGraph, PluginDeploymentGraph,
ReleaseDeploymentGraph is moved inside associations models, cascade behaviour
for references is added.

Change-Id: Id621682a97c770d4e5df53779c9500add7aeb63c
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

commit_message:
Fix livemigrationutils wmi connection getter

The BaseUtilsVirt constructor overides the _wmi_namespace template,
expanding it with the host it retrieves.

This causes issues to the livemigrationutils connection getter
as this relies on the _wmi_namespace attribute to build it's remote
WMI connection. This is a regression caused by this change:
Iaa68a4ccd333b9e23cc7c373571f34d56ca2857b

This patch fixes the issue by simply avoiding overriding this
attribute.

Change-Id: Ifdba8fb1dcf9bf428c4da40103f224a2714c6586

deleted_lines: mock_get_wmi_conn.assert_called_once_with(self.utils._wmi_namespace)

commit_message:
CentOS AFS build : move output to $WORKSPACE

The final copy happens out of $WORKSPACE, not the homedir.  Move the
generated repo there for copy.

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places.
Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.

Change-Id: I9c38d565bffad5d5473486e06545cc02b061bfd6
Closes-Bug:#1508442

subject: Simplify l2pop driver code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 17:44:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4c8792991409897741aebfae4515bc88e66a2659', 'message': 'l2pop to use binding info in db and ignore port status

l2pop should use only binding info in db and not port status for db entries.

1) port creation - after binding, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries with new port info.
2) port deletion - after deleting port in db(and binding levels),
   l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with deleted port info.
3) migration -
   a) after clearing the binding levels from old host,
      l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with old host and port info.
   b) after binding to new host, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries
      with new host and port info.

With this change, l2pop works for only create_port, update_port and delete_port
notifications and ignores get_device_details, update_device_down and
update_device_up notifications.

(UTs pending)

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-22 07:23:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/73313a505878b0e77f728bd2f81a276f60bb1916', 'message': "l2pop to use binding info in db and ignore port status

l2pop should use only binding info in db and not port status for db entries.

1) port creation - after binding, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries with new port info.
2) port deletion - after deleting port in db(and binding levels),
   l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with deleted port info.
3) migration -
   a) after clearing the binding levels from old host,
      l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with old host and port info.
   b) after binding to new host, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries
      with new host and port info.

With this change, l2pop works for only create_port, update_port and delete_port
notifications and ignores get_device_details, update_device_down and
update_device_up notifications.

l2pop driver shouldn't notify other agents to add/remove tunnels(and flood flows)
to a host, when first/last port on the network on that host added/deleted.

Instead agents will locally maintain port list on other agents(belonging to
hosted networks). When first port added to a agent's list, tunnel port created
to that agent and when list is empty, cleans up tunnel port to that agent.

Also it maintains all agent's port info per network locally. When first
port created on other agent on that network, will add a flood flow to that agent.
When last port on agent on that network is deleted, flood flow to that agent removed.

When agent is restated this local inforation is recreated. For this, when first port
detected on that agent on that network, agent requests all the ports fdb on that network,
and creates locat info, and accordingly creates/modifies tunnels and flows.

(todo: Take care of DVR and HA)
(UTs pending)

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 16:39:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/dae180873769a2b51b2d05c527a482136a423b76', 'message': 'l2pop to use binding info in db and ignore port status

And also, implement "identifying when to add/delete tunnel flows
and tunnel ports logic" in agent and remove it from driver

l2pop should use only binding info in db and not port status for db entries.

1) port creation - after binding, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries with new port info.
2) port deletion - after deleting port in db(and binding levels),
   l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with deleted port info.
3) migration -
   a) after clearing the binding levels from old host,
      l2pop should send remove_fdb_entries with old host and port info.
   b) after binding to new host, l2pop should send add_fdb_entries
      with new host and port info.

With this change, l2pop only notifies for create_port, update_port and delete_port
and ignores get_device_details, update_device_down and
update_device_up.

Previously, l2pop driver was identifying when first/last port on the network
on that host added/deleted, and accordingly l2pop driver was notifying other agents
to add/remove tunnels(and flood flows) to a host. This is removed from l2pop driver
in this change and instead this functionality is implemented in agent.

In this change, agents will locally maintain all remote agent's port info
per network locally(and only when local agent is hosting that network).
With this, agent can identify first port created on other remote agent on
that network, and accordingly will add a flood flow to that remote agent.
Similarly, agent identifies when last port on remote agent on that network
is deleted, and deletes flood flow to that remote agent.
When no port belonging to any network on remote agent exists(
identified through port info maintained locally in agent),
tunnel port to this remote agent is deleted.

On agent restart, this local information is recreated. For this,
when first port detected on that local agent on that network,
local agent requests all the ports fdb on that network,
creates local info, and accordingly creates/modifies tunnels and flows.

(todo: Take care of DVR and HA)
(Need to rework on l2pop UTs)

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c

updates for deciding and notifying a port's fdb to agent.
When port is bound to new host, notify port added to agents.
When port is unbound, notify port removal to agents.

And also, implement "identifying when to add/delete flood flows
and logic" in agent and remove it from driver.

network on a host added/deleted, and accordingly notifying other agents
to add/remove flood flows to this host. This is removed from l2pop driver
in this change and instead this functionality is implemented in agent.
As changes done on both l2pop driver and agent, same version of l2pop
driver and agent should be used for compatability(need to work more on this)

With this, agents will locally maintain all remote agent's port info
on a network in lvm(lvm exists when local agent is hosting that network).
lvm.tun_ofports={<remote_agent1_ofport>: [port1, port2, ..],
                 <remote_agent2_ofport>: [port3, port4, ..]}
For example, when port5 created on remote_agent1, port5 is added to
remote_agent1_ofport list and when port2 is removed from remote_agent1,
port2 deleted from remote_agent1_ofport list.
When last port removed from remote_agent1, lvm.tun_ofports['remote_agent1_ofport']
be empty and flood flow to this remote agent for that network is deleted.
When first port added in this list, flood flow to remote agent will be setup.

A new RPC added for agent to get list of network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list when first port on network(new lvm)
on this local agent created(same happens on agent restarts).

DVR and HA ports also taken care in the change.

(Need to rework on l2pop UTs)

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c

and one PortItem object for one port(instead of multiple PortInfo for one port).
PortItem will have port_id, mac and list of ip addresses.

A new RPC added for agent to get list of network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list when first port on network(new lvm)
on this local agent created(same happens on agent restarts).

commit_message:
Simplify l2pop driver code

l2pop to use only port bindings and ignore port status
updates for deciding and notifying a port's fdb to agent.
When port is bound to new host, notify port added to agents.
When port is unbound, notify port removal to agents.

Also, previously, l2pop driver was identifying when first/last port on the
network on a host added/deleted and
1) notify other agents to add flood flow to this host
2) notify the host about ports on other agents
This is not needed for new agents as they maintain port info. With
this, agents themselves will be knowing about first and last port on
same host and also on other agents. Server still will have this code for
backword compatibility with old agents.

With this, agents will locally maintain all remote agent's port info
on a network in lvm(lvm exists when local agent is hosting that network).
lvm.tun_ofports={<remote_agent1_ofport>: [port1, port2, ..],
                 <remote_agent2_ofport>: [port3, port4, ..]}
For example, when port5 created on remote_agent1, port5 is added to
remote_agent1_ofport list and when port2 is removed from remote_agent1,
port2 deleted from remote_agent1_ofport list.
When last port removed from remote_agent1, lvm.tun_ofports['remote_agent1_ofport']
be empty and flood flow to this remote agent for that network is deleted.
When first port added in this list, flood flow to remote agent will be setup.

In this change new field 'port' added to fdb_entries. Previously 'ports' field
in fdb_entries was used to carry fdb for multiple ports, like below
fdb_entries={'ports': {[PortInfo(mac1,ip1), PortInfo(mac2,ip2)]}}
PortInfo created for each ip address. So to carry fdb for single port with multilple
ip addresses, multiple PortInfo used, like below
fdb_entries={'ports': {[PortInfo(same_mac,ip1), PortInfo(same_mac,ip2),
             PortInfo(same_mac,ip3), PortInfo('00:00:00:00:00:00', '0.0.0.0')]}}
But new agents won't get multiple ports as cast message and also won't need
flood entry('00:00:00:00:00:00', '0.0.0.0'). So 'port' field added to fdb_entries,
which carries fdb for single port. Also PortItem is used instead of PortInfo,
and one PortItem object for one port(instead of multiple PortInfo for one port).
PortItem will have port_id, mac and list of ip addresses.

A new RPC added for agent to get list of network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list when first port on network(new lvm)
on this local agent created(same happens on agent restarts).

DVR and HA ports also taken care in the change.

Seperate change to be proposed for supporting linuxbridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/269212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # save old host for migration mech_context._l2pop['original_host'] = original_host # started a new db session with locking on Portbinding table. # As Portbindinglevels can be updated only with above lock, # no other processes can update Portbindinglevels for any port # simultaneously now, we check for active port count on agent on # port's network. active_port_count = db.get_agent_network_active_port_count( session, cur_binding.host, port_db["network_id"]) # sucessfully added this port, so increase port count active_port_count = active_port_count + 1 # store binding of migrated/new port to new host for l2pop cur_context._l2pop['active_port_count'] = active_port_count cur_context._l2pop['new_host'] = cur_binding.host # started a new db session with locking on Portbinding table. # As Portbindinglevels can be updated only with above lock, # no other processes can update Portbindinglevels for any port # simultaneously now, we check for active port count on agent on # port's network. active_port_count = db.get_agent_network_active_port_count( session, binding.host, port_db["network_id"]) # removing migrated port from old host, # so decreate port count on old host active_port_count = active_port_count - 1 mech_context._l2pop['active_port_count'] = active_port_count # started a new db session with locking on Portbinding table. # As Portbindinglevels can be updated only with above lock, # no other processes can update Portbindinglevels for any port # simultaneously now, we check for active port count on agent on # port's network. active_port_count = db.get_agent_network_active_port_count( session, binding.host, port_db["network_id"]) # sucessfully deleted this port, so reduce port count active_port_count = active_port_count - 1 mech_context._l2pop['active_port_count'] = active_port_count mech_context._l2pop['original_host'] = binding.host

commit_message:
Add documentation about the disk_label capability

This patch extending the current Install guide documentation to include
information about how one could request a specific disk label when
deploying a bare metal node.

Related-Bug: #1548788
Change-Id: Ib6d31a66db3e647abdb507f4741c64e99cd209e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/20/288520/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _choosing_the_disk_label: Choosing the disk label ----------------------- Ironic allows operators to choose which disk label they want their bare metal node to be deployed with when Ironic is responsible for partitioning the disk; therefore choosing the disk label do not apply when the image being deployed is a ``whole disk images``. There are some edge cases where someone may want to choose a specific disk label for the images being deployed, including but not limited to: * For machines in ``bios`` boot mode with disks larger than 2 terabytes it's recommended to use a ``gpt`` disk label. That's because a capacity beyond 2 terabytes is not addressable by using the MBR partitioning type. But, although GPT claims to be backwards compatible with legacy BIOS systems `that's not always the case <http://www.rodsbooks.com/gdisk/bios.html>`_. * Operators may want to force the partitioning to be always MBR (even if the machine is deployed with boot mode ``uefi``) to avoid breakage of applications and tools running on those instances. The disk label can be configured in Bare Metal service in the following way: * When no boot mode setting is provided Ironic will configure it according to the `boot mode <boot_mode_support_>`_; ``bios`` boot mode will use ``msdos`` disk label and ``uefi`` boot mode will use ``gpt``. * Only one disk label - either ``msdos`` or ``gpt`` - can be configured for the node. * To set the appropriated disk label to a bare metal node the command bellow can be used:: ironic node-update <node-uuid> add properties/capabilities='disk_label:gpt' The nova flavor that will be responsible for requesting such capability also needs to be updated as:: nova flavor-key baremetal set capabilities:disk_label="gpt"

commit_message:
Create murano application archives from TOSCA CSAR archives

As the first step toward supporting TOSCA CSAR archives in murano
this patch enables muranoclient to create murano application archives
("murano package-create") from TOSCA CSAR archives using the
"--tosca" argument. The latest tosca-parser pypi is used to validate
and extract information from the input CSAR archives.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-tosca-format

Change-Id: Ifd5d837a92ca385c484d9070b0fe5d2844fe9117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/71/232271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TOSCA_CSAR_DIR = os.path.join(FIXTURE_DIR, 'tosca-csar') def test_create_csar_based_package(self): self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'muranoclient.v1.client.Client', mock.MagicMock)) csar_archive = os.path.join(TOSCA_CSAR_DIR, 'csar_hello_world.zip') logo = os.path.join(TOSCA_CSAR_DIR, 'logo.png') self.make_env() with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as f: RESULT_PACKAGE = f.name c = "package-create --tosca={0} --output={1} -l={2}".format( csar_archive, RESULT_PACKAGE, logo) stdout, stderr = self.shell(c) matchers.MatchesRegex((stdout + stderr), "Application package " "is available at {0}".format(RESULT_PACKAGE))

commit_message:
Fix Gate tests

Seems [1] and an unnecessay inheritance may be the
cuplrit for the newly occurring failures [2] of
Python2.7 and Python3.4 gate jobs for tap-as-a-service.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1532258
[2]: http://paste.openstack.org/show/489947/

Closes-Bug: #1532258
Change-Id: I1b97fe8541c1c1325aaad739a30e5989c1fd806a

commit_message:
HyperV: Add FC attached volumes support

This patch adds support for attaching volumes exported via Fibre
Channel.

The disks are attached as passtrough disks, the guest being
unaware about the underlying topology.

Hyper-V can also expose virtual FC ports to instances, which
will be addressed in a separate commit.

Co-Authored-By: Alin Balutoiu <abalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Implements: blueprint hyperv-fibre-channel
Change-Id: I45b86e55cf06327f9bb11177f25e529ce1f43820

subject: Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 13:02:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/403019d9573ecb445e6bbfc49e0ce74aaa968f78', 'message': "Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates

This patch updates 'overcloud deploy' commands so that
updates (re-running deploy on an existing stack) generate
a unique DeployIdentifier parameter. By passing an unique
DeployIdentifier parameter into the overcloud stack we
force all puppet config tasks (which are idempotent
and safe to exec multiple times) again.

We've had several issues with puppet not-rerunning on
a variety of config related changes and additionally recieved
user feedback that not re-running all puppet deployments on
an update is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia659181872a6537cc169f1d1531ebf5d36160183
Closes-bug: #1505430
Depends-On: Ic352ddd30807dc378e5e7b6c396bc53f5d6d5622
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-21 15:02:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/005ceaa08ef48e16d5e01fcb6ee3be0eb5889922', 'message': "Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates

commit_message:
Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates

This patch updates 'overcloud deploy' commands so that
updates (re-running deploy on an existing stack) generate
a unique DeployIdentifier parameter. By passing an unique
DeployIdentifier parameter into the overcloud stack we
force all puppet config tasks (which are idempotent
and safe to exec multiple times) again.

We've had several issues with puppet not-rerunning on
a variety of config related changes and additionally recieved
user feedback that not re-running all puppet deployments on
an update is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia659181872a6537cc169f1d1531ebf5d36160183
Closes-bug: #1505430
Depends-On: Ic352ddd30807dc378e5e7b6c396bc53f5d6d5622
(cherry picked from commit ed945a9080556a20067be2a93831ff1f34b9ae9c)
